name: Deluxe Dolphin Lanai Snorkel Adventure I
description:
"LIKE" Captain Steve's Rafting Adventures on Facebook to follow our fun on the ocean!

This trip has stood the test of time and has been taken by literally thousands of guests, many of whom continue to return year after year. Captain Steve has been conducting this adventure for over three decades. Waste no time in discovering the secrets of the reef and playing with dolphins, whales, turtles, and rays. There is no telling what we might encounter on any given day! We head across the channel to the island of Lana’i (weather permitting of course) where towering sea cliffs, sea caves, secluded coves, and lava rock pinnacles make up the setting. Imagine a pod of 200-300 spinner dolphins putting on a show just for you or swimming next to an endangered green sea turtle in the crystal waters of the Pacific above the most exquisite fringing reef in the entire State of Hawaii. Perhaps you will catch a glimpse of the most curious creature on the reef, an octopus, or an endangered Hawaiian Monk Seal! Manta rays, spotted eagle rays, pseudorcas (false killer whales), spotted dolphins, and bottle nose dolphins are all possible on any snorkel trip!

The check-in time is 7:15 am and we return around 2'ish.  We typically have 2 snorkel stops.

A deli style lunch (wraps, chips, cookies) is included as well as midmorning banana bread and fresh fruit. High quality masks, fins, and snorkels are provided as is snorkeling instruction.  Floatation devices and life jackets are available upon request.

We recommend guests bring towels, cameras/underwater cameras, mineral based sunscreen, sunglasses, and jackets. Wear "slippahs" aka flip flops as we will be taking your shoes from you since this is a bare foot cruise. 
 
Effective 10/1/22, only mineral based sunscreens are allowed in the County of Maui.  Non-mineral sunscreen is any sunscreen that uses an active ingredient other than zinc oxide and titanium dioxide (mineral UV filters). Please bring only mineral based sunscreens and wear UPF shirts for sun protection.  Aerosol sprays are not allowed at the Mala Wharf or on our rafts to protect the reef and to improve the overall passenger experience.

All prices include taxes and harbor fees already.
notes:
Children must be at least 5 years old to ride on the rafts for snorkel adventures.  These excursions are NOT recommended for pregnant women, people with bad backs, neck problems, bad knees, bad hips, heart problems, elderly, or fragile people. This can be a physically demanding ride. Participants should be in good physical shape. You need to be able to climb a sturdy vertical ladder to get back on the raft after snorkeling. 
An electronic liability waiver must be signed for every trip by every person prior to arrival at the dock.
directions:
Check-in time is at 7:15 am. The check-in location is at the Mala Boat Ramp in Lahaina (closest GPS address is 1201 Front Street--NOT LAHAINA HARBOR). You can park in the Mala car spots, on Front Street, or on Ala Moana Street. You can also take an uber and ask them to drop you at the bathrooms to avoid congestion in the dock area.
From South or Central Maui (Kihei/Wailea/Kahului), follow the signs to Lahaina and Hwy 30. Once in Lahaina, Hwy 30 turns into HI-3000 (the bypass). Continue to the end and down Keawe Street. Stay in the right lane and turn right back onto Hwy 30. Get in the left lane immediately and turn left at the Safeway onto Kapunakea Street. Go down to Front Street and turn left. Drive behind the mall and then one more block. You will go over a little white bridge and then you will see the Mala Boat Ramp sign on the right (there is also a church on the right with a big blue “Jesus coming soon” sign on top it). Turn right onto Mala Road. Once on Mala Road, you will see free parking on the left and right sides as well as a restroom on the left side. PLEASE DO NOT PARK IN THE STALLS FOR TRUCKS AND TRAILERS. Head down to the dock and look for the ORANGE rafts marked "Captain Steve's."

From Kaanapali/Honokowai/Kahana/Napili/Kapalua--As you head south towards Lahaina on Highway 30, turn right at the Safeway/Cannery Mall onto Kapunakea Street.  Go down to Front Street and turn left.  Drive behind the mall and then one more block.  You will go over a little white bridge and then you will see the Mala Boat Ramp sign on the right (there is also a church on the right with a big blue "Jesus coming soon" sign on top).  Turn right onto Mala Road.  Once on Mala Road, you will see free parking on the left and right sides as well as a restroom on the left side. PLEASE DO NOT PARK IN THE STALLS FOR TRUCKS AND TRAILERS. Park and then head to the docks and wait on the side by the left hand dock for us to come check you in off of our orange Captain Steve's rafts. If you can't find parking on Mala Road, you can now park on Front Street.

name: 7:30 Whale Watch
description:
"LIKE" Captain Steve's Rafting Adventures on Facebook to follow our fun on the ocean! Captain Steve's Rafting Adventures contributes to science! Help us and get to know your whales too by sharing your whale tail photos at: https://happywhale.com/org/153

Captain Steve started this business to do whale watching.  No one does it better!  Our groups are small; our service is personalized; and we guarantee whale sightings. Our underwater hydrophone allows us to hear the singing whales, while our friendly Captains and Crew share their extensive knowledge for a very fun, highly educational experience.  Many guests return year after year to ride again with Captain Steve's!

We recommend guests bring cameras/underwater cameras, mineral based sunscreen, sunglasses, a bottle of water, and jackets. Wear "slippahs" aka flip flops as we will be taking your shoes from you since this is a bare foot cruise.  

Effective 10/1/22, only mineral based sunscreens are allowed in the County of Maui.  Non-mineral sunscreen is any sunscreen that uses an active ingredient other than zinc oxide and titanium dioxide (mineral UV filters). Please bring only mineral based sunscreens and wear UPF shirts for sun protection.  Aerosol sprays are not allowed at the Mala Wharf or on our rafts to protect the reef and to improve the overall passenger experience.

All prices include taxes and harbor fees already!
notes:
An electronic liability Waiver must be completed for every trip by every person prior to arrival at the dock. Children must be at least 3 years old to ride on the rafts for whale watches.  These trips are not recommended for people with bad backs, neck problems, bad knees, bad hips, heart problems, elderly, fragile people  or for pregnant women. 
----------

Know your boarding capability!
You will board our rafts at the Mala Small Boat Ramp. When the tide is high, loading is as simple as stepping onto the pontoon off of the dock and is quite easy. Getting off, you need to be able to step up onto the pontoon yourself and then onto the dock with a little balance help from your friends. When the tide is low, it can be a very large step down onto the pontoon from the dock. For safety when it is a very large step down, you might have to sit down on your derriere on the dock, swing your legs over and step onto the raft. This is usually no problem at all for most of us. However, it can be very difficult or impossible for those with hip/knee replacements or some older or fragile folks. To disembark at low tide, you may be required to step up on the pontoon, sit on your derriere on the dock, swing your legs up on the dock, then stand up (getting to your knees if you have to). Again, it can be difficult if you have hip/knee replacements. We encourage you to know your loading capability. To check when the tide is high, you can go to this link and put in the date (remember you will disembark two hours after you get on and the tide matters at both times). http://www.hawaiitides.com/Lahaina/GetTide.asp
directions:
Check-in time is at 7:15 am. The check-in location is at the Mala Boat Ramp in Lahaina (closest GPS address is 1201 Front Street--NOT LAHAINA HARBOR). You can park in the Mala car spots, on Front Street, or on Ala Moana Street. You can also take an uber and ask them to drop you at the bathrooms to avoid congestion in the dock area.

You will go over a little white bridge and then you will see the Mala Boat Ramp sign on the right (there is also a church on the right with a big blue “Jesus coming soon” sign on top it). Turn right onto Mala Road. Once on Mala Road, you will see free parking on the left and right sides as well as a restroom on the left side. PLEASE DO NOT PARK IN THE STALLS FOR TRUCKS AND TRAILERS. Head down to the dock and look for the ORANGE rafts marked "Captain Steve's."

From Kaanapali/Honokowai/Kahana/Napili/Kapalua--As you head south towards Lahaina on Highway 30, turn right at the Safeway/Cannery Mall onto Kapunakea Street.  Go down to Front Street and turn left.  Drive behind the mall and then one more block.  You will go over a little white bridge and then you will see the Mala Boat Ramp sign on the right (there is also a church on the right with a big blue "Jesus coming soon" sign on top).  Turn right onto Mala Road.  Once on Mala Road, you will see free parking on the left and right sides as well as a restroom on the left side. PLEASE DO NOT PARK IN THE STALLS FOR TRUCKS AND TRAILERS. Non-mineral sunscreen is any sunscreen that uses an active ingredient other than zinc oxide and titanium dioxide (mineral UV filters). Please bring only mineral based sunscreens and wear UPF shirts for sun protection.  Aerosol sprays are not allowed at the Mala Wharf or on our rafts to protect the reef and to improve the overall passenger experience.

All prices include taxes and harbor fees already!
notes:
An electronic liability Waiver must be completed for every trip by every person prior to arrival at the dock. Children must be at least 3 years old to ride on the rafts for whale watches.  These trips are not recommended for people with bad backs, neck problems, bad knees, bad hips, heart problems, elderly, fragile people  or for pregnant women. 
----------

Know your boarding capability!
You will board our rafts at the Mala Small Boat Ramp. When the tide is high, loading is as simple as stepping onto the pontoon off of the dock and is quite easy. Getting off, you need to be able to step up onto the pontoon yourself and then onto the dock with a little balance help from your friends. When the tide is low, it can be a very large step down onto the pontoon from the dock. For safety when it is a very large step down, you might have to sit down on your derriere on the dock, swing your legs over and step onto the raft. This is usually no problem at all for most of us. However, it can be very difficult or impossible for those with hip/knee replacements or some older or fragile folks. To disembark at low tide, you may be required to step up on the pontoon, sit on your derriere on the dock, swing your legs up on the dock, then stand up (getting to your knees if you have to). Again, it can be difficult if you have hip/knee replacements. We encourage you to know your loading capability. To check when the tide is high, you can go to this link and put in the date (remember you will disembark two hours after you get on and the tide matters at both times). http://www.hawaiitides.com/Lahaina/GetTide.asp
directions:
Check-in time is at 2:15 pm. The check-in location is at the Mala Boat Ramp in Lahaina (closest GPS address is 1201 Front Street--NOT LAHAINA HARBOR). You can park in the Mala car spots, on Front Street, or on Ala Moana Street. You can also take an uber and ask them to drop you at the bathrooms to avoid congestion in the dock area.
From South or Central Maui (Kihei/Wailea/Kahului), follow the signs to Lahaina and Hwy 30. Once in Lahaina, Hwy 30 turns into HI-3000 (the bypass). Continue to the end and down Keawe Street. Stay in the right lane and turn right back onto Hwy 30. Get in the left lane immediately and turn left at the Safeway onto Kapunakea Street. Go down to Front Street and turn left. Drive behind the mall and then one more block. You will go over a little white bridge and then you will see the Mala Boat Ramp sign on the right (there is also a church on the right with a big blue “Jesus coming soon” sign on top it). Turn right onto Mala Road. Once on Mala Road, you will see free parking on the left and right sides as well as a restroom on the left side. PLEASE DO NOT PARK IN THE STALLS FOR TRUCKS AND TRAILERS. Head down to the dock and look for the ORANGE rafts marked "Captain Steve's."

From Kaanapali/Honokowai/Kahana/Napili/Kapalua--As you head south towards Lahaina on Highway 30, turn right at the Safeway/Cannery Mall onto Kapunakea Street.  Go down to Front Street and turn left.  Drive behind the mall and then one more block.  You will go over a little white bridge and then you will see the Mala Boat Ramp sign on the right (there is also a church on the right with a big blue "Jesus coming soon" sign on top).  Turn right onto Mala Road.  Once on Mala Road, you will see free parking on the left and right sides as well as a restroom on the left side. PLEASE DO NOT PARK IN THE STALLS FOR TRUCKS AND TRAILERS. Park and then head to the docks and wait on the side by the left hand dock for us to come check you in off of our orange Captain Steve's rafts. If you can't find parking on Mala Road, you can now park on Front Street.

name: Feast at Lele
description:
Feast At Lele:
Fresh Flower Lei greeting. Open bar included throughout the evening. A sit-down, five-course dinner,
featuring cuisines of Hawaii, Aotearoa - New Zealand, Tahiti, Samoa, and Dessert. Menu created by Executive Chef
Adrian Aina. Each course is accompanied by dramatic Polynesian entertainment from each island. Example, the
Hawaiian course is accompanied by Hawaiian dances; New Zealand course is accompanied by New Zealand dances,
etc… Show created by Old Lahaina Luau.
directions:
Along the beach in historic Lahaina Town
505 Front Street, Lahaina, Maui, Hawaii 96761

name: Private Maui Sport Fishing - Hawaii Expedition
description:
Finest Kind, Reel Hooker and Exact are our three fishing boats. They are respectively a 37ft. Merritt, 35 ft. Bertram and 31ft. Bertram. All are licensed to carry 1-6 passengers plus Captain and Crew.   They are fully equipped for a full day of fishing including ice, cooler, bait & tackle,  You provide your own food and beverages.

Private Charters have flexible departure times. Time to be determined by captain.
directions: Slip #7 Lahaina Harbor
times: ARRIVE 15 MINUTES PRIOR TO YOUR DEPARTURE TIME

name: Classic Sunrise Tour
description: The Sunrise Tour offers guests an opportunity of a lifetime to view the sunrise from atop Haleakala at 10,000 ft. The tour is an exciting and informative guided vehicle tour of Haleakala National Park and the Upcountry area. Our Certified Guides will share with our guests the thrilling Culture and History of Maui along the way. Once inside Haleakala National Park, our interpretive guides will explore themes such as the unique Geology and Ecology of the surrounding area. After sunrise, guests will have an opportunity to visit the historic towns of Makawao and Paia.
notes:
Haleakala EcoTours is ADA compliant, but space is limited. Persons with disabilities should call for availability.

-We do have a rain or shine policy because the weather you see in one area will not always reflect what you will find at the Summit and is likely to vary during the duration of the tour.  In short, be prepared.

-All participants are required to acknowledge, understand the risks involved in this activity, and abide by the rules and guidelines provided to them. 


-Due to restrictions, limited resources, or other variables  we reserve the right to adjust trip details such as time, date and activity or services offered.  

-PLEASE CALL FOR AVAILABILITY and CONFIRMATION prior to your activity date.  Availability is subject to change.
directions:
West Maui Hotels availability Monday and Thursday

South Maui Hotels availability Tuesday and Friday

Central Maui hotels availability Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday.

description: GUIDED SUNRISE BIKE TOUR. Entrance and Tour of Haleakala National Park and GUIDED bike ride down Haleakala. We furnish Kona brand mountain bike, helmet, backpack, rain/wind gear, map with points of interest. Hotel Transportation
11 passenger transit
Interpretive Tour provided by NAI Certified Guides
Custom and private tours available
notes:

That is approximately 4 miles past Paia. At the 11 mile marker, there is a sign for Haiku and a street sign for Haiku Road. Turn right on Haiku Road, continue for another 1 1/2 miles. Now you are in downtown Haiku where we are located. Located in the Haiku Marketplace on left corner of Haiku Road and Kokomo Road is where you'll find our offices. 
If you lose your way, just call us at 808-575-9575 and we'll be glad to help

name: Sunset Tour
description:
Tour Haleakala National Park Tour and watch Sunset at the summit of Haleakala. Transportation will be provided in our comfortable 11 passenger Transit vans or 25 passenger mini bus.

Learn about Hawaii's history, culture, and natural resources from our trained and certified guides.
notes:
Haleakala EcoTours is ADA compliant, but space is limited. Persons with disabilities should call for availability.

We do have a rain or shine policy because the weather you see in one area will not always reflect what you will find at the Summit and is likely to vary during the duration of the ride.  In short, be prepared.

-All participants are required to acknowledge, understand the risks involved in this activity, and abide by the rules and guidelines provided to them. 

-We allow participants 12 years and older. Biking abilities may vary, but we welcome all to participate as long as they know how to ride a bicycle equipped with hand brakes, and are comfortable participating in such an activity.

-Due to restrictions, limited resources, or other variables  we reserve the right to adjust trip details such as time, date and activity or services offered.  

-PLEASE CALL FOR AVAILABILITY and CONFIRMATION prior to your activity date.  Availability is subject to change.

Go approximately 10 miles; you should find yourself at the 11 mile marker. That is exactly 4 miles past Paia. At the 11 mile marker, there is a sign for Haiku and a street sign for Haiku Road. Turn right on Haiku Road, go up the mountain 1 1/2 miles. Now you are in downtown Haiku where we are. Across the intersection to your left is an old cannery building. It’s been made into a mall, Haiku Marketplace, that's where we are. 
If you lose your way, just call us at 575-9575 and we'll be glad to help

name: Maui's Hula Girl Morning Snorkeling & Scuba Cruise
description:
Snorkel with the Hula Girl - Maui's most luxurious day charter catamaran.  It would be our pleasure to have you join us for a sailing, snorkeling, diving adventure on this 65x35ft. catamaran with impeccable standards of hospitality, service and cuisine.

PLEASE BE ADVISED YOUR CREDIT CARD WILL NOT BE CHARGED UNTIL YOU ARE ON-BOARD, IT IS A GUARANTEE ONLY AT BOOKING TIME.  WE ACCEPT CASH, AMERICAN EXPRESS, VISA, MASTERCARD, AND DISCOVER AS FORM OF PAYMENT AND THE CREW WILL REQUEST THIS AT THE END OF THE EXCURSION.

While sailing on the trade winds or resting at anchor, indulge yourself on four queen sized cushions with throw cushions on the two trampoline nets, relax on the plush couch seats beneath the mast or join the Captain in the VIP lounge fly bridge. 

Cruise along Maui's scenic coastline to premiere snorkeling destinations such as the Honolua Bay Marine Sanctuary.  Top quality snorkeling gear is included.  An individualized snorkel lesson is provided for first timers.

Professional dive instructors will guide certified and  introductory divers with all scuba gear included for an additional fee.  Our custom designed dive platforms provide divers with an ample area to gear up with easy water entry's.  Sixteen tanks and Bauer dive compressor on board.

Dine in air-conditioned comfort in the spacious Main Salon with cushioned seating and granite tables.  Ala carte menu, refreshments and cocktail selection available for purchase.  Menu selection from: $7-29 - Beverages $5-12 Bottle of wine $26.00.  The Hula Girl staff will open a tab for you on-board and your excursion, food and bar purchases will be closed out at the end of the sail.

Hula Girl is a beach loading catamaran, all cruises are barefoot and shoes will be collected before boarding and stored onboard.  We recommend wearing shorts and bathing suits.  Please bring beach towels and sunscreen (preferably use "REEF SAFE SUNSCREEN".)  Please be advised oils and spray bottles of sunscreen are not allowed on board.

The Hula Girl Captains & Crew await the pleasure of your company!
notes: No Wheel Chair Access.  Must be able to walk unassisted up the beach boarding ladder.
directions: All cruises depart from the Kaanapali Beach area, beach boarding in front of the Whalers Village Shopping Center.  Paid parking is available at the Whalers Village Parking lot. Please be advised we can not validate parking for the paid lot, we recommend you go to any of the shops or restaurants and make a purchase to receive 3 free hours parking sticker to save you $.  We reserve the right to move the loading site to the north side of Black Rock if surf prevents us from beach loading at Whalers Village beach front.  Please check your phone for text messages or calls prior to departing for the excursion.
times: Check in time 8:45am Cruise time 9am-2pm. Please call 808 665-0344 to reconfirm your reservation and boarding location. Look for our crew on the beach.  Please bring Beach Towel and Sunscreen (no oils or spray b

name: Hula Girl Pacific Rim Dinner Cruise
description:
** Available on Tuesday, Wednesday Thursday, Friday, Saturday & Sunday ** .
PLEASE CALL RESERVATION SERVICE TO RECONFIRM YOUR CRUISE AND DEPARTURE  TIMES** 808 665-0344

PLEASE BE ADVISED YOUR CREDIT CARD WILL NOT BE CHARGED UNTIL YOU ARE ON-BOARD, IT IS A GUARANTEE ONLY AT BOOKING TIME.  WE ACCEPT CASH, AMERICAN EXPRESS, VISA, MASTERCARD, AND DISCOVER AS FORM OF PAYMENT AND THE CREW WILL REQUEST THIS AT THE END OF THE EXCURSION.

This is the perfect choice for an upscale sunset dinner cruise at incredibly reasonable prices. Please be advised your credit card will not be charged until you are onboard and at the end of the sail.  The focus of this excursion will be cruising the scenic West Maui Coastline to anchor in a calm protected cove at beautiful Kapalua.  Enjoying fine dinning while at anchor with mouth watering cuisine prepared fresh on-board by our talented chefs! Choose from our extensive appetizers, entrees or try the Chef's fresh fish special.  Our crew/waitstaff will take your dinner order with the first cocktail service. For the grand finale choose from one of our sumptuous desserts while sailing downwind! Finally Maui has a Dinner Cruise with truly world class cuisine.

A top shelf selection of tropical cocktails, fine wines, and imported beers are available for purchase from $5 to $12  For wine lovers a bottle of fine wine only costs $26.00

Dine in air-conditioned style in the spacious Main Salon with granite tables and cushioned seating.  Enjoy fine dinning with stunning views. 

Please call the reservation to confirm loading location and check in times at 808 665-0344.  All sails are barefoot cruises and shoes are collected prior to boarding and stored onboard.  We recommend wearing shorts for beach boarding and bringing a light jacket for evening events.  

Please call our reservation service upon arrival in Maui to reconfirm check in time and location @808 665-0344 or 667-5980. Please note your credit card is a guarantee only, your trip will be added to your food and bar tab onboard and charged at the end of the excursion.

Hula Girl and it's professional crew await the pleasure of your company.
notes: No wheel chair access. Must be able to walk unassisted up the beach boarding ladder.
directions: Beach loading at Kaanapali Beach, beach front of the Whalers Village Shopping Center.  Paid parking is available at the Whalers Village Shopping Center, please be advised we can not validate your parking, we recommend making a purchase at the shopping center or restaurants for 3 free hour parking sticker to save you $. We reserve the right to relocate to the North side of Black Rock for beach loading if a large swell prevents loading at Whalers Village.  Please be sure to check your phone for texts or calls should this be necessary for safe loading.
times: Please call our office at 808 665-0344 to reconfirm departure time and location.  Check in time 2:45pm for a 3pm departure returning after the sun has set.

name: Sunset Sail
description:
Join the Hula Girl for a two hour Sunset Sail.  PLEASE CALL TO RECONFIRM CHECK IN TIME AND LOADING LOCATION 808 665-0344.  

PLEASE BE ADVISED YOUR CREDIT CARD WILL NOT BE CHARGED UNTIL YOU ARE ON-BOARD, IT IS A GUARANTEE ONLY AT BOOKING TIME.  WE ACCEPT CASH, AMERICAN EXPRESS, VISA, MASTERCARD, AND DISCOVER AS FORM OF PAYMENT AND THE CREW WILL REQUEST THIS AT THE END OF THE EXCURSION.

The focus of this excursion will be high tech sailing in West Maui's trade-winds  Hula Girl is decked out with Spectra racing sails and will be sure to please even the most passionate sailor while offering luxury and comfort from bow to stern with cushioned on deck seating.  

Please be advised your credit card is being held as a guarantee only, you will be charged at the end of the sail. 

Choose from our extensive appetizer menu with prices from $10.00 to $32.00 and enjoy the premium brand cocktails and beverages priced from $4.00-$12.00  For wine lovers a bottle of wine is only $26.00.  Please note the Hula Girl crew will open a tab for you onboard, your excursion and all food and bar purchases will be charged at the end of the sail.

Hula Girl is a beach loading catamaran, all cruises are barefoot and shoes are collected prior to boarding and will be stored onboard.  We recommend wearing shorts and bringing a light jacket for evening events.
notes: No Wheel Chair Access. Must be able to walk up the beach boarding ladder unassisted.
directions: Meet on the beach in front of the Whalers Village, Kaanapali Beach.  Please be advised we can not validate your parking in the paid lot, we recommend you make a purchase at the shops or restaurants for 3 free hours parking sticker to save you $.  Please call the  reservation service for check in times @ 808 665-0344.  We reserve the right to move the loading to the North side of Black Rock  if the south swell prevents safely beach loading at Whalers Village beach front.
times: Check in time 3:45pm for a 4pm departure returns after the sun has set.Please call the reservation service to reconfirm check in and departure times once you arrive on Maui @808 665-0344, sail times change seasonally.

name: Deluxe Whale Watch Dinner Cruise
description:
** Available During Whale Season - Tuesday, Wednesday,Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday ** PLEASE CALL FOR DEPARTURE TIMES AND LOADING LOCATION 808 665-0344 (changes seasonally)

This is the perfect choice for an upscale dinner cruise at incredibly reasonable prices with whale watching. The focus of this excursion will be whale watching in the calm waters of West Maui while enjoying mouth watering cuisine prepared on-board by our talented chefs! Choose from our extensive appetizers, entrees or try the Chef's fresh fish special.   Finally Maui has a Whale Watch Dinner Cruise with truly world class cuisine.

A top shelf selection of tropical cocktails, fine wines, and imported beers are available for purchase from $5 to $12.00.  For wine lovers a bottle of fine wine only costs $25.

Dine in air-conditioned comfort in the spacious Main Salon with granite tables and cushioned seating.  

Please call for check in and boarding times. Check in 15 minutes prior to charter time at the Whalers Village Shopping Center beach front in Kaanapali Beach. All sails are barefoot cruises and shoes will be collected prior to boarding and will be stored onboard.  We recommend wearing shorts for beach boarding and bringing a light jacket for evening events.  We reserve the right to relocate to boarding at the Mala Boat Ramp if surf prevents us from safely beach loading.

Please call our reservation service upon arrival in Maui to reconfirm check in time and location @808 665-0344 or 667-5980. Please note your credit card is a guarantee only. Your excursion will be added to your food and bar tab onboard and charged at the end of the cruise.

Hula Girl and it's professional crew await the pleasure of your company.
notes: No wheel chair access
directions: Beach loading at Kaanapali Beach.  Paid parking is available at the Whalers Village Shopping Center, please be advised we can not validate parking in the paid lot, we recommend making a purchase from the shops or restaurants for 3 free hours of parking.  We reserve the right to relocate the boarding location to Mala Boat Ramp and using our tender if the surf or wind prevents us from safely beach loading.
times: Please call reservations for current departure times @808 665-0344. Please note your credit card is being used only as a guarantee.  Crew will charge for the excursion and ala carte purchases at the end of the cruise.

name: Sunset Whale Watch
description:
** Available during whale season - Mondays ** 4:00pm-6:30pm.  PLEASE CALL 808 665-0344 TO CONFIRM CHECK IN TIME AND LOADING LOCATION.

Join the Hula Girl for a two hour Sunset Whale Watch Cruise.  The focus of this excursion will be watching Maui's most famous vistiors the Humpback Whales.  Excellent photo opportunity's from the comfortable security of the stable decks.   

Please be advised your credit card will not be charged until you are onboard, it is being held as a guarantee only. 

Choose from our extensive appetizer menu with prices from $6-$25 and enjoy the premium brand cocktails and beverages priced from $3-8.  For wine lovers a bottle of wine is only $25.00.

We recommend wearing shorts and bringing a light jacket for evening events.  All Cruises are barefoot, shoes will be collected prior to boarding and stored onboard.  

We reserve the right to relocate to boarding at the Mala Boat Ramp in Lahaina with our tender, if surf and wind prevents from safely beach loading.
notes: No Wheel Chair Access
directions: Meet on the beach in front of "Leilani's" Restaurant - Whalers Village, Kaanapali Beach.  Departure times change seasonally, please call our reservation service to reconfirm check in time and location - @ 808 665-0344 prior to charter date.  Please be advised we can not validate parking at the Whalers Village Paid lot, we recommend you make a purchase from the shops or restaurants to receive 3 free hour parking sticker.  We reserve the right to move the loading site to Mala Boat Ramp in Lahaina if the surf prevents us from safely loading on the beach.
times: Please call our office at 808 665-0344 to reconfirm departure time and location.

name: Fourth of July Fireworks Sunset Sail
description:
Special time 4:30pm-8:45pm  Ala carte dinner menu and bar.  Departing from Ka'anapali Beach - check in time 4:15 pm.  Enjoy an evening of Sailing, followed by anchoring for dinner service and Fireworks show in the calm waters off of Lahaina.  Disembarking will start at approximately 8:30pm-8:45pm.  

Please call our office prior to departing for this special event in case we have changed to loading on the north side of Black Rock due to a Summertime south swell at Whalers Village beach front. 
808 665-0344
notes: No wheel chair access - Must be physically fit and be able to climb in and out of zodiac tender from the dock.
times: 4:30-8:30pm - check in at 4:15pm on Ka'anapali Beach. Look for Hula Girl.

name: Halloween Dinner Party
description: Join us for the annual Hulaween Costume Party on the Hula Girl catamaran!  Best Costume wins a Hula Girl T-Shirt. Special time 3:00pm to 7:00pm, loading at the Mala Boat Ramp to allow us to return after dark.  Check in time at the Mala Boat Ramp for zodiac loading is 2:45pm. Excursion includes sailing, anchoring for the Ala Carte dinner service, best costume contest and trick or treat candy!  Don't forget to upgrade to premium tables!
notes: No wheel chair access - Must be physically fit and be able to climb in and out of zodiac tender from the dock.
times: 2:45pm meet at the Mala Boat Ramp for zodiac loading to the Hula Girl - sail times 3:15pm - 7:00pm - unloading with the tender from 7:00pm-7:30pm.

name: New Years Eve Party 2021
description: New Years Eve 2021 Party - Special time 3pm-7pm with coursed plated appetizers and dinner service, whale watching, ala carte bar.  Departing from Mala Boat Ramp - check in time 2:45pm on the dock.  Enjoy an evening of appetizers, whale watching in the calm waters off of Lahaina, followed by plated dinner and dessert service while at anchor from 6pm-7pm.  Disembarking will start at 7pm.  Don't forget to upgrade to premium tables!
notes: No wheel chair access - Must be physically fit and be able to climb in and out of zodiac tender from the dock.
directions: Mala Boat Ramp in Lahaina - take Front Street to Lahaina.  Turn toward the ocean on Mala Wharf Rd.  Look for parking on the side of road or by Jodo Mission.  Parking is free, however we recommend that you do not leave values in your car and leave the car locked.
times: 3pm-7pm - check in at 2:45pm on the dock at Mala Small Boat Ramp.  Look for Hula Girl crew and a white zodiac that well be tendering guests in groups of 4-6.

name: Valentines Whale Watch
description: Join the Hula Girl for a Romantic night of Whale Watching and dinning!  The focus of this excursion will be whale watching in the calm waters of West Maui while enjoying mouth watering cuisine prepared on-board by our talented chefs!  Choose from our extensive appetizers, entree's or try the Chef's fresh fish special.  Don't forget to upgrade to premium tables!
notes: No wheel chair access - Must be physically fit and be able to climb in and out of zodiac tender from the dock.

supplierName: Lahaina Cruise Co, Hawaii Ocean Project
name: Maui Princess Sunset Dinner Cruise
description:
Enjoy an evening of dining and dancing aboard the 118' Maui Princess.  Watch the sun set into the horizon while dining on the open-air upper deck.  Table-side service includes a choice of Prime Rib, Chicken, Fish or Vegetarian meals with 3 free drinks.  After the sun goes down, enjoy live music and dancing.  An evening to remember aboard Maui Princess Dinner Cruise.  

Major credit cards accepted.
notes: Must be 21 years of age or older to drink alcoholic beverages.  ID's required, regardless of age.
directions:
Check in 4:45 pm
Lahaina Harbor Maui, Hawaii Ocean Project booth on main loading dock across from the Pioneer Inn     (808)667-6165   www.mauiprincess.com
Nightly cruises depart at 5:30pm return at 8pm.

supplierName: Lahaina Cruise Co, Hawaii Ocean Project
name: Lanai Dolphin Snorkel
description:
Two snorkel sites; weather permitting. Built for comfort, Kaulana is the most stable Catamaran on Maui.  Trip includes Water Slide, Water Toys, Snorkel Equipment and Instruction, Continental breakfast, BBQ lunch & one complimentary cocktail included. 
Unlimited soda and juices are also available.  Cash Bar-Beer and Wine $5 and Mixed Drinks $6 , alcoholic beverages available after snorkeling.
notes: Must be 21 years of age or older to drink alcoholic beverages.  ID's required, regardless of age.
directions:
Check in at 6:30 am
Lahaina Harbor Maui, Hawaii Ocean Project booth on main loading dock across from the Pioneer Inn     (808)667-6165   www.hawaiioceanproject.com
times: Departure at 7 AM return at approximately 1 PM

supplierName: Lahaina Cruise Co, Hawaii Ocean Project
name: Early Bird Whale Watch 7:30 a.m.
description:
Big, Fast Boats
Depart from Lahaina for a Maui whale watching experience you'll always remember. Our big, comfortable boats get you quickly to each whale sighting, with an enclosed main cabin and upper observation deck to ensure dry, excellent visibility.

Guaranteed Whale Sightings - or you go again FREE! 
  
Whale watch cruises starting at just $26.35 per adult.  Children 3 and under FREE.  One child per paying adult.

We get you to the whales fast, in our big stable boats.  Enjoy the sun or the shade while you watch for whales and experience scenic Maui from the water.
  
Japanese translation available.. 
 

 
 
Our Maui whale watch cruises may include:
Whale Cam?, the live underwater video equipment (attached to the vessel), with on-board monitors for incredible viewing opportunities. (Subject to ocean and visibility conditions and proximity to whales)
  

Expert narration with the latest scientific information about humpback whales.
  

Professional captains and crew are aboard to answer questions and explain witnessed whale behavior.
  

Smooth, un-crowded, cruises aboard our big, fast boats..
  

On-board gift shop
  

Beverages and snacks available
directions: Lahaina Harbor Maui, H.O.P. booth on main loading dock across from the Pioneer Inn     (808)667-6165   www.mauiprincess.com
times: Check-in at 7am.  The boat departs at 7:30 and returns at 9:30.

times: Check-in at 1:45pm.  Departs at 2:15 and returns at 4:15pm.

name: 7:30 AM Lanai Dolphin Adventure – 7:00 AM Check-in
description:
Available: Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday

Description:
Start your morning with Kona coffee, passion orange juice and ice water during check-in at Slip 11 in Lahaina Harbor.
After leaving Lahaina Harbor, we head across the 'Au'Au channel to the island of Lana'i. Two snorkel sites are selected by the captain to offer the clearest and calmest ocean conditions. Snorkel gear, instructions and safety tips are provided by our experienced captain and crew. 

Spinner and bottlenose dolphins are often encountered off the island of Lana'i with lots of tropical reef fish, green sea turtles and occasional manta rays at the snorkel sites.
 
Tropical treats including fresh fruit and homemade breads are served on-board after departing the harbor. Lunch (turkey wraps, buttermilk dressing, Maui chips, pineapple and cookies) is served on-board at one of the snorkel sites, along with unlimited sodas, juices and bottled water during the trip.
notes:
Notes/Restrictions: Must be 5 years or older; no pregnant women or persons with back or neck ailments or recent surgeries.  Your responsibility to inform operator prior to making reservations or booking. 

Amenities: We provide snorkel gear and flotation noodles, but feel free to bring your own. Don't forget your towel and sunscreen (no sprays).  Underwater cameras, Maui Adventure Cruises logo wear hats & T-Shirts and a great Snorkeling & Whale Watch Souvenir DVD are available for purchase at our booth located at Front Row Slip #11 in Lahaina Harbor.
directions: Directions: Check-in at 675 Wharf St. Lahaina Harbor Front Row Slip 11. Paid parking is available at the Republic Parking lot on the corner of Dickenson Street (off main hwy) & Wainee Street (the stop sign) for $14.00 all day. From there it is a 3 block walk to the harbor. Parking closer to the harbor costs $20.00 or more.  A close lot is behind the Wharf Cinema Center (across Front St. from the Banyan Tree) with an entrance off Wainee St.  Check times and rates.

name: 1:30 PM Coastline Snorkel & Raft Adventure-1:00 PM Check-in
description:
This 3-hr.afternoon Snorkel & Raft Adventure departs Lahaina Harbor Front Row Slip #11.  Our 50-ft "Explorer Super Raft" (the largest in Hawaii) cruises to the best snorkel site for that day's weather and sea conditions (captain's choice).  Going north options include Cliff House, Kapalua Bay and Honolula Bay Marine Preserve.  Heading south the main destination is Olowalu Reef and then returning to Lahaina Town and possibly Mala Sunken Wharf known for its turtle town.

Our experienced crew will find the best location to snorkel for over 1 hour to enjoy tropical fish, coral reefs, green sea turtles and the occasional spotted eagle ray and moray eel.  Lessons, quality snorkel gear and floatation devices are all included; all you need to bring is sunscreen (no sprays) and a towel!!  Enjoy tropical snacks and juices, sodas and bottled water during the trip.

The fast and comfortable Explorer Super Raft has the "Cadillac Ride" with its deep V-hull and plenty of padded seating and a large bimini tip for lots of shade.  Our custom designed vessel even has an on-board marine head/restroom, large swim step, two loading ladders and fresh water rinse shower for your swim and snorkel adventure.
notes:
Must be 5 years or older; no pregnant women or persons with back or neck ailments or recent surgeries. Your responsibility to inform operator of serious medical conditions prior to making reservations or booking. 

Amenities: We provide snorkel gear and flotation noodles, but feel free to bring your own. Don't forget your towel and sunscreen.  Underwater cameras, Maui Adventure Cruises logo wear hats & T-Shirts and a great Snorkeling & Whale Watch Souvenir DVD are available for purchase at our booth located at Front Row Slip #11 in Lahaina Harbor.
directions: Check-in at 675 Wharf St. Lahaina Harbor Front Row Slip 11. Parking is available at the Republic Parking lot on the corner of Dickenson Street (off main hwy) & Wainee Street (the stop sign) for $14.00 for 8 hours. From there it is a 3 block walk to the harbor. Closer lot is behind Wharf Cinema Center (across Front St. from the Banyan Tree) with an entrance off Wainee St.  Check times and rates.

name: HoloHolo Whale Watch Pass
description:
THE GREATEST VALUE FOR AVID WHALE WATCHERS
10 trips at anytime and any days during the Whale Season.
1 free trip and the other 9 trips at the reduced child price rate---for a savings of $199.00!!!  Only $441 plus taxes.  One Pass for one person; non-transferable (even amongst family members--thanks).

WHALE WATCH ADVENTURES---CHOOSE FROM 7 DAILY TRIPS
Enjoy whale watching on our Explorer Super Rafts, the largest rafts in Hawaii.  Our twin engine Explorer Super Rafts are very fast and comfortable with padded seats and a large bimini top for plenty of shade and give our guests more time to watch whales and less traveling time. Be a part of the action close to the water and the whales. Enjoy a truly remarkable experience with our Humpback Whales -- the leviathans of the deep.

Every seat is a "front row seat" with great viewing. Hear the "songs of the Humpback Whales" from our Hydrophones on-board our Explorer Super Rafts.

With up close and personal viewing, our Explorer Super Rafts offer our guests  "an ocean level view" of the whales (not 15 feet above the water as in the larger boats), and provide our guests the opportunity to be close to the action and the whales.

Avoid the crowds of the larger boats - it is more fun to view the whales with a few friends rather than 100+ strangers!
notes:
No one under 5 years of age.  No pregnant women or persons with bad back or neck aliments or recent surgeries.  Your responsibility to notify operator of serious medical conditions prior to reservation and booking.

Whale Pass not eligible for use on the daily 10:00 am Whale Watch Adventure trip.

Parking is available at the Republic Parking lot on the corner of Dickenson Street (off main hwy) & Wainee Street (the stop sign) for $8.00 all day. From there it is a 3 block walk to the harbor. Parking closer to the harbor costs $15.00 or more.  A close lot is behind the Wharf Cinema Center (across Front St. from the Banyan Tree) with an entrance off Wainee St.  Check times and rates.

name: July 4th SUNSET FIREWORKS CRUISE!!
description:
The best place to view the 4TH OF JULY FIREWORKS is from our EXPLORER SUPER RAFTS close to the action! Enjoy a beautiful sunset followed by fireworks with unobstructed views. Sodas, bottled water, juices and heavy pupus and snacks included. 

For those who would like an alcoholic beverage they are invited to BYOB.  We will supply disposable glassware and ice for drinks for prep purposes. (Please note however that this is a family friendly trip so no drunken or inappropriate conduct will be allowed. Be considerate of your fellow passengers.)

Our Explorer Super Rafts are the largest in Hawaii and have plenty of comfortable padded seating and even an on-board marine head/restroom if necessary.
notes:
Must be at least 5 yrs old. Must be able to board vessel and be controllable by their adult companion.  Be considerate of your fellow passengers.
Must be ready to have fun!
directions: Arrive early to Lahaina as traffic is expected to be busy.  Best parking is at pay lot on corner of Dickenson St and Wainee St.(Republic Parking); also lot behind old Lahaina Coolers at Dickenson Square building. Expect Front St. to be closed to traffic.
times: Check- in at LAHAINA HARBOR SLIP 11 AT 6:30PM. TRIP WILL DEPART PROMPTLY AT 7:00PM

supplierName: Maui Canyon Adventures Inc., dba Rappel Maui
name: Rappel Maui Tour-- 8:00 a.m.
description:
Learn to walk down walls of water and rock and enjoy a beautiful "walk on the wild side" with Maui's boldest and most unique adventure -- cruising down waterfalls into a rainforest canyon. We teach you how to rappel on a 60-foot dry jungle cliff-side, and once you've "learned the ropes," the 50-foot falls is next. Your third "rap" is a 30-foot waterfall, your final descent into the wild. 

We rappel in a privately-owned valley located an hour out on the Hana Highway and now you too can see its beauty up close and personal. Duration may vary depending on group size and abilities of participants. The estimated total tour duration is approximately 3 hours.

THE ADVENTURE SUMMARIZED
- Destination: a 26-acre botanical garden where you gear up in topnotch equipment.
- Hike a short distance on rainforest trails into this private valley.
- Training: on a high ridge overlooking the valley the guides give you a "show 'n tell."
- 60-foot dry jungle wall: This is where you learn and practice handling your rope and finding your balance.
- 50-foot waterfall rappel into a deep waterfall pool.
- 30-foot falls, technically more difficult, into a natural waterfall pool.

DETAILS
All gear provided, including special footwear.
Bring a cloth mask, change of clothing and towel.
Toilets and changing rooms at the base camp.
Snacks and bottled water included.
notes: Children under 18 years are welcome when accompanied by a responsible adult. Our harnesses will fit waist sizes from 22 to 48 inches. Minimum age is 10 years. Maximum weight is 250 lbs. If you are outside of our requirements at arrival, you may remain at the activity site, but not on the rappelling course. All participants must sign and return the participation form via electronic method before the tour date. Parents who do not accompany their child to the activity site will e-sign the form ahead of time.
directions: Meet at the activity site on the Hana Highway between mile markers 10 and 11 at 10600 Hana Highway Haiku, HI 96708 at the Garden of Eden Arboretum. Please be prompt, as guests are not able to join the tour once it begins, and guides leave the meeting place promptly after the designated tour time. You can find a Google map to this location at https://goo.gl/maps/PLniBQ64w9Qz1oPd6

- 30-foot falls, technically more difficult, into a natural waterfall pool.

DETAILS
All gear provided, including special footwear.
Bring a cloth mask, change of clothing and towel.
Toilets and changing rooms at the base camp.
Snacks and bottled water included.
notes: Children under 18 years are welcome when accompanied by a responsible adult. Our harnesses will fit waist sizes from 22 to 48 inches. Minimum age is 10 years. Maximum weight is 250 lbs. If you are outside of our requirements at arrival, you may remain at the activity site, but not on the rappelling course. All participants must sign and return the participation form via electronic method before the tour date. Parents who do not accompany their child to the activity site will e-sign the form ahead of time.
directions: Meet at the activity site on the Hana Highway between mile markers 10 and 11 at 10600 Hana Highway Haiku, HI 96708 at the Garden of Eden Arboretum. Please be prompt, as guests are not able to join the tour once it begins, and guides leave the meeting place promptly after the designated tour time. You can find a Google map to this location at https://goo.gl/maps/PLniBQ64w9Qz1oPd6

supplierName: Maui Canyon Adventures Inc., dba Rappel Maui
name: Rappel Maui Tour--1:00 p.m.
description:
Learn to walk down walls of water and rock and enjoy a beautiful "walk on the wild side" with Maui's boldest and most unique adventure -- cruising down waterfalls into a rainforest canyon. We teach you how to rappel on a 60-foot dry jungle cliff-side, and once you've "learned the ropes," the 50-foot falls is next. Your third "rap" is a 30-foot waterfall, your final descent into the wild. 

We rappel in a privately-owned valley located an hour out on the Hana Highway and now you too can see its beauty up close and personal. Duration may vary depending on group size and abilities of participants. Estimated total tour duration is approximately 3 hours.

THE ADVENTURE SUMMARIZED
- Destination: a 26-acre botanical garden where you gear up in topnotch equipment.
- Hike a short distance on rainforest trails into this private valley.
- Training: on a high ridge overlooking the valley the guides give you a "show 'n tell."
- 60-foot dry jungle wall: This is where you learn and practice till you get it right. 
- 50-foot waterfall rappel into a deep waterfall pool.
- 30-foot falls, technically more difficult, into a natural waterfall pool.

DETAILS
All gear provided, including special footwear.
Bring a mask, change of clothing and towel.
Toilets and changing rooms at the base camp.
Snacks included.
notes: Children under 18 years are welcome when accompanied by a responsible adult. Our harnesses will fit waist sizes from 22 to 48 inches. Minimum age is 10 years. Maximum weight is 250 lbs. If you are outside of our requirements at arrival, you may remain at the activity site, but not on the rappelling course. All participants sign a participation form before the tour, either online or in person. Parents who do not accompany their child to the activity site may e-sign the form ahead of time.
directions: Meet at the activity site on the Hana Highway between mile markers 10 and 11 at 10600 Hana Highway Haiku, HI 96708: The Garden of Eden Arboretum. Please be prompt, as guests are not able to join the tour once it begins, and guides leave the meeting place at the designated tour time. You can find a map of the area at https://goo.gl/maps/PLniBQ64w9Qz1oPd6

Experience Maui's rainforest from the immediacy of natural jungle cliffs and waterfalls during Maui's boldest and most satisfying adventure. Under the supervision and instruction of expert guides, you'll learn to walk down waterfalls into a private canyon. name: Four Winds AM Molokini Snorkel
description:
*CHECK IN TIME IS 7:00 am 
 
Maalaea Harbor, Slip #80 - Four Winds II (boat is on the ocean side). 

The harbor offers metered parking and is payable by credit card only. Please scan QR code located at the harbor to pay for parking. Please call Secure Parking Hawaii directly with any parking questions: 1-808-517-1311.

*THE DEPARTMENT OF LAND AND NATURAL RESOURCES HAS NOW MANDATED THAT ALL PARKING AT MAALAEA HARBOR BE PAID. PLEASE FIND THE "PAID PARKING STALLS" UPON ARRIVAL AND PAY IN ADVANCE BY SCANNING THE QR CODE AT THE HARBOR TO AVOID BEING TOWED BY SECURE PARKING HAWAII. 

TRIP INCLUDES: 
Tropical breakfast, deluxe BBQ lunch, selection of complimentary beer, wine, juice, sodas, and water.
All snorkel gear, flotation, and instruction included.

WHAT TO BRING: 
Towel, swimsuit, camera, reef safe sunscreen (non-aerosol), sunglasses, and a light cover-up.

OPTIONAL SNUBA: 
Available on board for $75. Please secure your spots in advance. Spaces are limited.
notes: A 24 HOUR CANCELLATION POLICY APPLIES FOR ALL RESERVATIONS: To change or cancel a reservation, please call us directly. You can review our policy at: https://www.fourwindsmaui.com/terms/
directions:
TO MAALAEA HARBOR:

FROM LAHAINA, KAANAPALI OR KAPALUA:
Take HWY 30 south. You will travel along the coast for a while and eventually come to Maui's only tunnel. About three (3) miles after the tunnel, there will be green highway sign reading "U.S. Coast Guard Station". Turn right at the sign and drive down towards the harbor. Stay to your right hand side and drive onto the jetty. The Four Winds II is in Slip #80, located on the ocean side at the very end just before the brown building.

FROM KIHEI, WAILEA OR MAKENA:
Take South Kihei Road will end at a "T" lighted intersection. Turn left onto North Kihei Road (HWY 310). Continue on this road, at traffic light turn left onto HWY 30 (towards Maalaea and Lahaina). Take next left at stoplight onto Kapoli Street by Maui Ocean Center. Take Kapoli Street down to the stop sign and turn right onto Maalaea Harbor Road. Drive into the Harbor, and bear left onto the jetty. The Four Winds II Slip #80 is located on the ocean side at the very end, next to the brown building.

FROM KAHULUI:
Take HWY 380 west to HWY 30. At the 2nd stoplight (where HWY 380 ends) turn left onto HWY 30. Follow the signs to Maalaea. Turn left at stoplight onto Kapoli Street by Maui Ocean Center. Take Kapoli Street down to the stop sign and turn right onto Maalaea Harbor Road. Drive into the Harbor, and bear left onto the jetty. The Four Winds II Slip #80 is located on the ocean side at the very end, next to the brown building.

CAUTION USING GPS:
Because navigation to a boat dock is not accurate USE CAUTION. Please make sure the address and directions are to Maalaea Harbor and NOT our office in Kihei. Use the address below which will navigate you to Maalaea Harbor entrance.  
GPS Use This Address: 11 Maalaea Boat Harbor Rd., Wailuku, HI 96793

name: Morning Molokini Snorkel 4 hour Excursions
description:
Thank you for choosing Maui Snorkel Charters for your snorkel adventure! Our 4 hour tour on the No Ka Oi includes a 20 minute ride to Molokini where we snorkel 2 spots, and then move on to a turtle spot returning back to the dock by 11:00 AM.* 

The No Ka Oi is a comfortable boat limited to 18 people for a more personal experience. It is our goal for all of our passengers  to have "the best day ever"! We love families!

*weather/conditions permitting
    
We provide all snorkel equipment.  The No Ka Oi is equipped with flotation devices to ensure everyone has a great experience. A small marine head is available for your convenience.  

  
To ensure an on time departure please check in by 6:45AM at the Kihei Boat ramp.    Tour leaves the ramp at 7:00AM.

Address: 2800 South Kihei Road.  

Guests staying on the west side (Lahaina & Kaanapali area) please allow a 60 minute travel time to the Kihei Boat Ramp. 
*weather/conditions permitting
notes:
Space is limited so please limit your personal items! Wear bathing suit and cover up clothes. Don't forget a  towel, jacket and your camera for those Kodak moments.  
Due to cover-19 we are unable to serve food a this time.  Please feel free to bring snacks.  Water and soda will be available through out the tour.
directions:
Depart from Kihei Boat Ramp address:  2800 South Kihei Road

*This tour is NOT intended for pregnant women due to the possibilities of rough seas and the nature of the ride.

name: 7:30 Whale Watch
description:
Come join us for a 1.5 hour whale watch aboard the NoKaOI!.

Our newly refurbished vessel is an intimate boat with a large deck space, it has been custom retrofitted for a smooth and comfortable ride.  Limited to 20 people for a more personal experience. It is our mission for parents and kids to have "the best day ever"! We love families!
    
The NoKaOI  allows for customers to see up close and personal everything that our Maui coastal waters have to offer.  Passengers  will not be standing 3 deep and trying to look over someone's shoulder when the dolphins are spinning or the mama whale and her baby decide to show us what Maui is really about!
directions:
Depart from Kihei Boat Ramp address:  2800 South Kihei Road

*This tour is NOT intended for pregnant women due to the possibilities of rough seas and the nature of the ride.

name: Share Snorkel Tour
description:
Whether this is your first snorkel tour or your fifth, you will find our Share Snorkel Tour to be simply unforgettable.

During this four hour adventure you will fall in love with the dazzling array of sea life as you snorkel among Maui's beautiful reefs. You will experience some of Maui's secret locales and awe-inspiring views, and you will explore and marvel at the vibrant colors of tropical fish as you truly discover the world beneath the waves. 
 
Maui Snorkel Tours' Share Tour is an expertly planned, guided tour that is designed with one goal in mind - to provide you with a lifetime of memories! 

Your tour package includes snorkel, mask, fins, wetsuit, flotation vest, and light snacks and refreshments. 

All prices include tax and any gear needed.

"Share" means you may be grouped with other snorkelers. Even though it’s a combined group with other individuals, it is limited to 6-7 snorkelers to maintain your level of personal attention.

SHARE TOUR COST: 
For 2 snorkelers, the cost is $135.43 per snorkeler.
 
When there are 3 snorkelers or more, the cost is $103.13 per snorkeler.


*Maui Snorkel Tours will confirm the Share Tour with a minimum of 2 snorkelers at the $135.43 rate. If additional snorkelers join, the rate will drop to $103.13 per snorkeler.
notes:
Your safety, comfort and enjoyment are Maui Snorkel Tours' main concerns in choosing a snorkel site for your tour. Many of the best sites are located along remote Maui coastline. 

The following are suggestions that will maximize your snorkeling experience:

1. Do not bring valuables that you will leave in your car. Theft is unlikely, but the areas are remote and break-ins do happen occasionally.     
2.  Wear your bathing suit under your clothes and bring sun screen, towels and drinking water.
3.  Wear shoes that are easy to take on and off.

We look forward to snorkeling with you, Aloha!

name: Private Snorkel Tour
description:
Whether this is your first snorkel tour or your fifth, you will find our Private Snorkel Tour to be simply unforgettable.

During this four hour adventure you will fall in love with the dazzling array of sea life as you snorkel among Maui's beautiful reefs. You will experience some of Maui's secret locales and awe-inspiring views, and you will explore and marvel at the vibrant colors of tropical fish as you truly discover the world beneath the waves. 
 
Maui Snorkel Tours' Private Tour is an expertly planned, guided tour that is designed with one goal in mind - to provide you with a lifetime of memories! 

Your tour package includes snorkel, mask, fins, wetsuit, flotation vest, and light snacks and refreshments. 

All prices include tax and any gear needed.

"Private" means you/your group are the only snorkelers on the tour with your own personal snorkel guide. This allows you the freedom to tailor this tour to your preferences.

PRIVATE TOUR COST: 
The cost is $166.67 per snorkeler, minimum 2 snorkelers.
 

*Guests with limited water abilities are usually required to book a private tour. Please call to inquire.
notes:
Your safety, comfort and enjoyment are Maui Snorkel Tours' main concerns in choosing a snorkel site for your tour. Many of the best sites are located along remote Maui coastline.

2.  Wear your bathing suit under your clothes and bring sun screen, towels and drinking water.
3.  Wear shoes that are easy to take on and off.

We look forward to snorkeling with you, Aloha!

name: 9:00 am Stand UP Paddle
description: 2 hour hour Stand up Paddle lesson
notes: NONE
directions: Meet  8:40am  @ 505 Front St. #201 -upstairs

name: 9:00 am Stand Up Paddle Semi-Private Lesson
description:
Feel the stoke and experience the passion we have for SUP. A sport for all fitness levels and skills. The progression moves from flat water to surf, depending on the client’s goals. Safety essentials, including wind, weather and tide basics, are included in the instruction. All instructors are Ocean Lifeguard, CPR & first Aid certified.

The beauty of standup paddle boarding is that it can be done anywhere with access to water. You don’t need any specific conditions and the whole sport can be as hardcore or tranquil as you like.

One key advantage that stand-up has is the thorough way in which it can be used to develop your body and mind which can also benefit you outside of the sport.

name: 9:00 am Private Surf Lesson
description:
The surf instructor is there to walk the client through, step-by-step, how to catch and ride a wave. All clients will have an opportunity to surf plenty of waves, depending on the individual and level (first time surfer, beginner intermediate or advanced) the lesson will also incorporate how to read waves, technique, style, tricks and any other goals an individual has. After surfing we have fresh water showers to rinse off, cold bottled water and certificates for each student. 
FOR GROUPS OF MORE THAN 5 PLEASE CALL US AT 808-244-SURF (7873).
directions: All Surf lessons begin with sign in at our office located at 505 Front Street in Lahaina.

name: Maui Jet Ski Rental 8:00AM  45 Minutes
description:
Enjoy the pure excitement of riding a jetski in the beautiful waters of Maui off the Kaanapali coast. We offer one of the most powerful jet skis made today - the Honda Aquatrax.

Perfect Family Fun
Great for couples, Parents with kids. *
Take turns being the driver
16 years + may drive on their own
15 years may drive with an Adult
14 years or younger are passengers
You are going to love it!
Drive your own High Performance Machine. Make high-speed tight turns.

Easy to Ride: Attach the engine shut-off clip to your lifevest before you start your jet ski. Next, place both your hands on the handlebars and slowly squeeze the throttle with your first two fingers. While you are in close proximity to the shore or dock, keep your speed at trolling, the lowest level. Once away from the dock, have fun, but be safe. Stay inside the buoys while you ride and avoid other jet skiers and boats. Be sure to stay aware of your surroundings at all times when you are riding your jet ski.

Riding 2-on-1 Jet Ski: Sometimes riders want to add a friend or child on the back of their jet ski. While it's great fun to ride two on one ski, we recommend two adults rent two skis for maximum extreme fun!

Safety Tip: Always stay 300 yards or 100 meters apart. Be sure to stay aware of your surroundings at all times when you are riding your jet ski. If possible, go out on the water with a friend so that you will have help in case of an emergency.

A complete lesson and safety briefing is given. Everyone must wear a life jacket. Your rental time won't begin until you start your machine. There is no rush, no hurry. Rental time begins when you start your machine. Anyone can do it, nonswimmers and physically challenged.
notes: You CAN be injured by riding a jet ski. Jet skis are relatively safe, but because they are so much fun, people tend to forget their safety zone and sometimes collide with other skis or boats. Pacific Jet Sports (MAUI JET SKI) mandates keeping at least 300 feet apart from the nearest jet ski or boat , be aware of your surroundings - always look right and left as you ride - and most importantly, be safe & have fun! YOU ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR INJURIES AND DAMAGE TO YOUR JET SKI RENTAL.
directions:
On the west shore:

1. Kapalua
KAPALUA TO MAUI JET SKI RENTAL: The distance from Kapalua to the jet ski rental location in Ka'anapali is about 7 miles; or about 13 mins drive time. 1. Head northeast on HI-30 toward Office Rd 30 ft -- 2. Turn left at Office Rd 30 ft -- 3. Turn left at Honoapiilani Hwy 6.7 mi -- 4. Turn right 443 ft -- and park your rental car at Hanakao?o Beach Park. Look out on the water and you can see the jet skis; walk toward the Hyatt Resort and pick up your shuttleboat under the red umbrella.
See the map from Kapalua to Maui Jet Ski Rental


2. Lahaina
LAHAINA TO MAUI JET SKI RENTAL: From Lahaina it only takes about 10 minutes to get to the jet ski rental location. Just head northwest on HI-30 toward Papalaua St 2.5 mi -- 2. Turn left 443 ft -- and park your car at Hanakao?o Beach Park (Canoe Beach) To find your jet ski, just walk down the beach toward the Hyatt, and pick up your ski under the red umbrella.
See the map from Lahaina to Maui Jet Ski Rental


On the South shore:

1. Kihei
KIHEI TO MAUI JET SKI RENTAL: If you are staying in Kihei, you can get to the jet ski rental location in about 45 minutes drive, just around the bend by the wind-mills. Driving distance 24.8 mi. To get there, just head north on HI-31 toward Kaonoulu St 5.5 mi -- 2. Turn left at HI-30 18.2 mi -- 3. Turn left 443 ft -- and park at Hanakao?o Beach Park (Canoe Beach) Walk along the beach toward the Hyatt and pick up your jet ski under the red umbrella.
See the map from Kihei to Maui Jet Ski Rental


2. Wailea
WAILEA TO JET SKI RENTAL LOCATION: If you are coming from the Grand Wailea Resort Hotel & Spa 3850 Wailea Alanui Drive in Wailea, HI 96753 the distance to the jet ski rental is about 30 mi ?and (if there is no traffic) it will take you 55 mins to get there. Please arrive 10 minutes prior to your scheduled rental time. - Park your car at Hanakao?o Beach Park (Canoe Beach). First, head southeast on Wailea Alanui Dr toward Wailea Ike Dr 0.2 mi -- 2. Turn left at Wailea Ike Dr 0.5 mi -- 3. Continue on HI-31 10.9 mi -- 4. Turn left at HI-30 18.2 mi -- 5. Turn left and park at Hanakao?o Beach Park (Canoe Beach) - Walk along the shoreline toward the Hyatt Resort. We are under the red umbrella.
See the map from Wailea to Maui Jet Ski Rental


3. Makena
MAKENA TO JET SKI RENTAL To get to the jet ski location, follow basically the same route as driving from Wailea. Total distance 33.0 mi ? driving time about 1 hour 5 mins. If you are leaving the area by the Fairmont Kea Lani, just head northwest on Makena Alanui toward Makena Rd 1.3 mi -- 2. Continue on Wailea Alanui Dr 0.9 mi -- 3. Turn right at Wailea Ike Dr 0.5 mi -- 4. Continue on HI-31 10.9 mi -- 5. Turn left at HI-30 18.2 mi -- 6. Turn left 443 ft -- and park at the Hanakao?o Beach Park (Canoe Beach) Walk along the shoreline toward the Hyatt Hotel. We are under the red umbrella. 
See the map from Makena to Maui Jet Ski Rental

name: Maui's Only Water FlyBoarding (30 mins) 9:00 AM
description:
Fist to offer this Flyboard experience in Maui, Maui Water Sports is offering rentals of up to 30 minutes, ever hour. 

Located off the beautiful Ka'anapali beach, North of Lahaina.  Quantities are limited, only 2 jet packs available. The Flyboard is a  of water jetpack attached to a personal water craft (PWC) which supplies propulsion to drive the Flyboard through air and water to perform a sport known as flyboarding. A Flyboard rider stands on a board connected by a long hose to a watercraft. Water is forced under pressure to a pair of boots with jet nozzles underneath which provide thrust for the rider to fly up to 15 m (49 ft) in the air or to dive headlong through the water down to 2.5 m (8 ft).[2]
notes:
16 years of age or older
Participant weight between 85 and 315 pounds
Pregnant women cannot participate

supplierName: Paradise Eco Adventures at Maui Dragon Fruit Farm
name: Morning Maui Dragon Fruit Farm Tour (9:00am)
description:
Come learn about organic farming and tour Maui's first commercial dragon fruit farm. 

The farm is located about five minutes from Lahaina nestled below the majestic West Maui mountains with a panoramic breathtaking ocean view. Directions will be sent in the confirmation email.  

The tour includes a guided stroll around the farm where guests learn about Maui's agricultural history and Hawaii's varies tropical fruit cultivation including dragon fruit, coconuts, bananas, papayas, pineapple, sour sop, sapote, etc.   

The duration of the tour is about one hour. Closed toed shoes are recommended. Dragon fruit season is normally from mid June to November each year. Fruit tasting include tasting samples of coconut water, dragon fruit, pineapple, papaya, mango, bananas, avocado, sour sop, longon, sapote, star fruits, passion fruits, cherimoya, etc. depending on each type of fruit's seasonality.
directions: Off Highway 30 turn on Kai Hele Ku Street at the traffic light and drive toward West Maui mountains. At the round about turn left to Haniu Street; drive pass first Punakea loop and at the second Punakea Loop turn right toward the mountain. Pass four houses and at the end of the white fence you will be at the Dragon Fruit Farm. Watch for the rock wall and the farm sign. Drive into the farm and park at the parking lot.

name: Morning Maui Dragon Fruit Farm Tour (10:00am)
description:
Come learn about organic farming and tour Maui's first commercial dragon fruit farm. 

The farm is located about five minutes from Lahaina nestled below the majestic West Maui mountains with a panoramic breathtaking ocean view. Directions will be sent in the confirmation email.  

The tour includes a guided stroll around the farm where guests learn about Maui's agricultural history and Hawaii's varies tropical fruit cultivation including dragon fruit, coconuts, bananas, papayas, pineapple, sour sop, sapote, etc.   

The duration of the tour is about one hour. Closed toed shoes are recommended. Dragon fruit season is normally from mid June to November each year. Fruit tasting include tasting samples of coconut water, dragon fruit, pineapple, papaya, mango, bananas, avocado, sour sop, longon, sapote, star fruits, passion fruits, cherimoya, etc. depending on each type of fruit's seasonality.
directions: Off Highway 30 turn on Kai Hele Ku Street at the traffic light and drive toward West Maui mountains. At the round about turn left to Haniu Street; drive pass first Punakea loop and at the second Punakea Loop turn right toward the mountain. Pass four houses and at the end of the white fence you will be at the Dragon Fruit Farm. Watch for the rock wall and the farm sign. Drive into the farm and park at the parking lot.

name: Full Day Private Hawaii Fishing Expedition (8 Hours)
description:
Rascal is located in slip #13 at Maalaea Harbor. There is paid parking available behind the boat. There is additional paid parking in the large lot behind the aquarium and shops (Use "300 Maalaea Road, Wailuku HI" for your GPS to get to the parking lot).

You will need to provide your own food/beverages (no glass containers, please), and personal items like sun screen. Coolers are not necessary as there is ample ice on board. Oh yeah.... leave the bananas at home. They're considered bad luck.

For those wanting a little time out of the sun, portions of the back deck are shaded, and our main cabin is air-conditioned with a full galley and comfortable seating. For those wanting great views from atop there is additional seating in front of the flybridge. This vessel is fully equipped with all the gear you'll need to catch an experience of a lifetime.
times: 6:00 AM (Check in 5:45 AM) ARRIVE 15 MINUTES PRIOR TO DEPARTURE

name: Morning Snorkel Sail
description:
Enjoy a 4-hour Morning Snorkel Sail along the West Maui Coast over coral reefs with colorful tropical fish and green sea turtles.  Expert instruction and quality snorkel gear and swim noodles are included. Complimentary beverages - champagne, white wine, local beers, sodas, and juices - and then homemade breads and treats are served as we sail along Maui’s scenic coastline. Relax, soak up the sun and enjoy the thrill of sailing on a world-class mono hull sailing yacht. 

After your snorkel excursion, lunch is served including turkey (or veggie) wrap, potato chips and cookies (Note* - Alcoholic beverages are served only after snorkeling and swimming.)

Just bring your swim suit, sunscreen, towel and adventurous spirit and experience a world-class sailing and snorkeling adventure with Scotch Mist Sailing Charters.
notes: Notes/Restrictions: Must be 5 years or older; no pregnant women or persons with back or neck ailments or recent surgeries.  Your responsibility to inform operator prior to making reservations or booking.
directions: Check-in at 675 Wharf St. Lahaina Harbor Front Row Slip 2. Parking is available at the Republic Parking lot on Dickenson Street (off main hwy) near corner of Wainee Street (the stop sign). From there it is a 3 block walk to the harbor. Closer paid parking lot is behind the Wharf Cinema Center across Front Street from the Banyan Tree with entrance off of Wainee Street. Check times and rates.

name: Morning Adventure Sail
description:
Enjoy two hours of sailing off the majestic West Maui Coast. Champagne, local beers, white wine, sodas, juices and bottled water are also available throughout the sail

Operates: Daily 9:00 AM Tuesday, Thursday & Saturday
Check-in: 8:45 AM Lahaina Harbor Front Row Slip #2
Duration: 2 hours
Equipment: 50' Santa Cruz sailing yacht

Bring your camera for great photos of the Maui coastline & Mountains and Lahaina Town from the water---and prepare for a truly wonderful, awe-inspiring sailing experience!

Paid Parking on Dickenson Street near corner of Wainee St (Republic Parking) 3 blocks from the harbor. Closer lot is behind the Wharf Cinema Center (across Front St. from the Banyan Tree) with entrance off of Wainee St.  Check for times and rates.
notes: No children under 5 years of age.  No pregnant women or persons with back or neck aliments or recent surgeries.   Your responsibility to notify operator of all serious medical conditions prior to reservation and booking.
directions: 675 Wharf St. Lahaina Harbor at Front Row Slip #2

name: Champagne Sunset Sail
description:
Enjoy two hours of sailing off the majestic West Maui Coast, sipping champagne and indulging in chocolates while the sun settles into the Pacific. Local beers, white wine, sodas, juices & bottled water are also available.

Operates: Daily 
Departure Times Optimized for Sunset. 

Check-in: at Lahaina Harbor Front Row Slip 2 --- 30 min. prior to departure time.

Duration: 2 hours
Equipment: 50' Santa Cruz sailing yacht

Bring your camera for great photos of the West Maui Coastline & Mountains and Lahaina Town from the water and the always fabulous sunsets---and prepare for a truly wonderful, awe-inspiring romantic sailing experience!  

There is NO designated harbor parking. Allow yourself the time to find street parking or use one of the numerous public or pay lots in town. Paid parking behind the Wharf Cinema Center (across Front St. from the Banyan Tree) with entrance off of Wainee St. Check for times and rates.
notes: Notes/Restrictions: No children under 13 of age. No pregnant women or persons with bad backs or neck aliments or recent surgeries. Your responsibility to advise operator of serious medical conditions prior to reservation and booking.
directions: 675 Wharf Street Lahaina Harbor Front Row Slip 2
times: Optimized for Sunset - Exact Time in your Confirmation Email

name: July 4th Fireworks & Champagne Sail
description:
JULY 4th FIREWORKS SPECIAL!!!

Enjoy two hours of sailing and watch the July 4th Fireworks display off the majestic West Maui Coast, sipping champagne and indulging in chocolates while experiencing the patriotic fireworks show and the exploding ramparts above.  Local beers, white wine, sodas, juices and bottled water are also available.

Check-in: 6:45 @ Lahaina Harbor  Front Row Slip #2
Duration: 2 hours
Equipment: 50' Santa Cruz sailing yacht

Bring your camera for great photos of the Fireworks Special---and prepare for a truly wonderful, awe-inspiring patriotic 4th of July experience!
notes: 21 years and older.  No children or minors.
directions: 675 Wharf Street Lahaina Harbor Front Row Slip #2
times: 6:45 pm check-in at Lahaina Harbor Slip #2 (7:15 pm departure).  There is NO designated harbor parking.  Allow yourself the time to find street parking or use one of the numerous public or pay-lots in town.)

name: 8:00 AM Deluxe Dolphin Adventure & Lanai Snorkel 6 hour
description:
Check in at 7:30am at Lahaina Harbor, Slip 17, located at 675 Wharf Street, Lahaina HI.
.
.
.
The Deluxe Dolphin Adventure & Lanai Snorkel includes 3 Snorkel Stops and Dolphin Watching!
.
.
.

Explore 3 different snorkel sites on Lanai and Maui where you will see dolphins (90% of the time), turtles, rays, tropical fish, sea cliffs, blow Holes, sea bird sanctuary, lava tubes and royal burial sites. Enjoy a guided Lanai Tour from the water with our seasoned Captains and Crew! Location is weather dependent and subject to change from Lanai to Maui if weather does not permit channel crossing. 
.
.
.
BREAKFAST, LUNCH, SNACKS & DRINKS INCLUDED:
(food included in group tours though not for private tours)
We offer fresh local banana bread, topped with lilikoi cream cheese and a side of fruit for our on the water breakfast. Lunch includes fresh chicken, turkey or veggie wraps and Maui style chips and cookies prepared daily by the chefs at Down the Hatch’s gourmet kitchen. Gluten-free and vegetarian options available by request. Beverages provided. BYOB (no glass please).
.
.
.

The Boat is Rated for 34 passengers. We limit seating to 26 guests to  snorkel Maui and Lanai. Our boats were built and modeled after the Coast Guard’s rescue craft to ensure a safe, quick and maneuverable boat ride. This tour vessel also offers a restroom* onboard and a fresh water shower for rinsing off ocean water. 

.
.
WHAT TO BRING: Bring a towel, swimsuit and camera! We provide your mask, snorkel and fins for your snorkel trip. Wetsuit tops are available for rent $10. We also provide complimentary reef safe, non-chemical sunscreen for your use during your snorkel trip.
.
.
.
RESTRICTIONS: No back, neck injuries, pregnant ladies. Must be 4yrs + & able to swim.
notes:
People that shouldn't participate in this adventure: pregnant women, children under 4 and people with spinal injuries. 
The 24 Hour Cancellation Policy applies to this reservation.

Ultimate Whale Watch and Snorkel reserves the right to cancel customer's booking for a full refund in case of bad weather or not enough travelers for the tour to operate.
directions:
Lahaina Harbor, slip 17, at the corner of Wharf and Canal Street, just off of Front Street in Lahaina. CHECK IN AT 7:30AM

PARKING
Paid parking lots are located within a block of Lahaina Harbor. Free parking lot is for parking 3 hours or less. For ride-share, drop off at Lahaina Harbor Slip 17.
