name: A 9:00 AM Whale Watch & Lanai Snorkel 4 hour
description:
CHECK IN 830am SLIP 17 LAHAINA HARBOR. 
.
.
Lanai Turtle Snorkel includes 1-2 snorkel stops and dolphin watching! During Whale Migration (Dec-April) this tour includes whale watching!
May include Manele Bay, Sweetheart Rock or other top snorkel spots on Lanai. See Dolphins (90% of trips), Turtles and Tropical Fish and Sea Cliffs. Enjoy a guided Lanai Tour from the Water with our Seasoned Captains and Crew!
.
.
.

BREAKFAST, SNACKS & DRINKS
We offer fresh local banana bread, topped with lilikoi cream cheese and a side of fruit for breakfast. Snacks include Maui style chips and cookies prepared daily by the chefs at Down the Hatch’s gourmet kitchen.
BYOB (no glass please).
.
.

* Booking this trip during winter season (Dec-April) it will include whale watching and one less snorkel location. Location is weather dependant and subject to change from Lanai to Maui if weather does not permit channel crossing. 
.
.
.

TOUR VESSEL
Our Vessels take small groups of no more than 26 guests to snorkel Lahaina, Maui and Lanai. Our boats were designed after military / rescue boats to ensure a safe, quick and fun comfortable ride.
.
.
.

WHAT TO BRING
Bring a towel, swimsuit and camera! We provide Mask, Snorkel and Fins for your snorkel trip. Wetsuit tops are available for rent.
We provide complimentary Reef Safe non-chemical sunscreen for your use during our snorkel trip.
.
.
.
RESTRICTIONS
No back, neck injuries, pregnant ladies. Must be 4yrs + & able to swim
.
.
.

* Booking this trip during whale migration (Dec-April) will include whale watching in lieu of a snorkel stop.
notes:
Caution:People that shouldn't participate in this adventure: pregnant women, children under 4, people with spinal injuries. 
24 Hour Cancellation Policy applies to this reservation.

Ultimate Whale Watch and Snorkel reserves the right to cancel customer's booking for a full refund in case of bad weather or not enough travelers for the tour to operate. 

24 Hour Cancellation Policy applies to this reservation.

name: Private Charter Raft
description:
Private Charter. 

For Snorkel Tours: See dolphins on our Lanai trips (90% of the time), turtles, rays, tropical fish and sea cliffs. Enjoy a guided Lanai Tour from the water with our seasoned Captains and Crew! Booking this trip during whale migration (Dec-April) will include whale watching in lieu of one snorkel stop. 

For Whale Watch Tours: 
EXPERIENCE the difference!
Small Group Ocean Adventure Experience!

Marine Naturalist Guides
Hear the whale song live on our hydrophone
Excellent Photo Opportunities
Every Seat is a Front Row Seat
Depart Lahaina Harbor Slip 17
CHECK IN 20 MIN PRIOR YOUR DEPARTURE TIME
Specializing in Whale Watching off Maui since 1982

OPTIONAL (additional cost per person) : 
BREAKFAST, LUNCH, SNACKS & DRINKS
We offer fresh local banana bread, topped with lilikoi cream cheese and a side of fruit for our on the water breakfast ($10/person). Lunch includes fresh chicken, turkey or veggie wraps and Maui style chips, prepared daily by the chefs at Down the Hatch’s gourmet kitchen ($15/person). Gluten-free and vegetarian options available by request. Beverages provided. BYOB (no glass please).

TOUR VESSEL
Our Rafting Vessels take small groups to snorkel Maui or Lanai. Our boats were built and modeled after the Coast Guard’s rescue rafts to ensure a safe, quick and maneuverable boat ride. No restroom onboard. 
 
WHAT TO BRING
Bring a towel, swimsuit and camera! For Snorkel Tours we provide masks, snorkel and fins for your snorkel trip. Wetsuit tops are available for rent. We also provide complimentary reef safe, non-chemical sunscreen for your use during our snorkel trip.

Cancellations for a full refund can be requested 72 hours prior to reservation date. 

15% Gratuity has been included, though can be adjusted after your tour if you'd prefer.
notes:
RESTRICTIONS
No back or neck injuries, as well as pregnant ladies. Children must be 4 years old and able to swim.
directions: Lahaina Harbor, slip 17. Corner of Warf and Canal St. off of Front St.

name: 8am 2 Hour Private Aloha Kai Charter (Vessel Accommodates 1-6 Guests)
description:
Aloha Kai is our designated research vessel that can also be chartered for private tours up to 6 guests. This vessel is a power cat style, not a raft. Departing out of Mala Boat Ramp, at the end of Mala Wharf Road just off of Front Street in Lahaina HI. 
72 Hour cancelation policy from date of reservation.

15% gratuity for your crew has been included, though can be adjusted after your tour if you'd like.

*DISCLAIMER
This vessel's PRIMARY purpose to for whale rescue and disentanglement. If at any time this vessel is needed for whale disentanglement or rescue and the vessel is no longer available for the charter booked, guests will be rescheduled or refunded.
notes:
No back injuries or pregnant women. 
Cancelations for a refund can be made 72 hours prior your departure time.
directions:
MALA WHARF BOAT RAMP, Lahaina Maui

DIRECTIONS FROM KAANAPALI/KAPALUA, North of Lahaina: 
Take Hwy 30, Honoapiliani Hwy South. Turn right onto front street and go about 2 miles, you will pass the back of Cannery mall and Safeway on your left side and Lahaina Luau on your right side, drive over a concrete bridge and past Snorkel Bobs and make the first right turn, from there you can park anywhere and walk down to the boat ramp where the boats are located. 

DIRECTION FROM KIHEI/WAILEA (South of Lahaina)
Take the hwy 30 Honoapiilani Hwy to Lahaina town- Turn left onto Papalaula Street go 2 blocks and then a right onto Front street and go about 1 mile north, you will see a church with a sign saying Jesus Coming Soon, turn left right before the church (if you pass a SnorkelBbobs and Lahaina Luau you’ve gone to far).  Drive towards the boat ramp, from there you can park anywhere and walk down to the boat ramp where the boats are located. 

Your boat Aloha Kai will be waiting for you tied at the ramp. Check in with your captain there.

name: Bronze Luau Package

supplierName: Aloha Kai Luau at Sea Life Park
name: Silver Luau Package

supplierName: Aloha Kai Luau at Sea Life Park
name: Gold Luau Package
FULL DAY OAHU BIKE,KOOLAU HIKE, SAIL & SNORKEL ADVENTURE
description:
Your day begins discovering O`ahu's lush volcanic rain forest. This moderate 2-mile round-trip guided hike is an opportunity to explore the hidden rainforest of the Ko'olau rainforest.  Following the hike, you'll enjoy an easy 5-mile tropical ride coast downhill on a paved road nestled in the lush Pu`u `Ohia rain forest. This unique experience combines Hawai`i's tropical rain forest with magnificent panoramic views of scenic O`ahu. To end your day, relax on an intimate sail and snorkel off the beautiful Diamond Head coastline.  

Includes: Includes complimentary pick up from Waikiki for the Bike & Hike portion only and then we'll drop you off at the Kewalo Basin just 2-miles west of Waikiki. After your sail and snorkel, you will need to jump in a taxi, UBER, or Lyft at your own expense. We supply Rain gear, KHS cruiser bikes, helmets, and guides. Masks, snorkels, swim fins, and life jackets are provided at no extra charge. Due to COVID, please wear masks upon pick up and during transfer.
notes: Transportation included for Bike and Hike only, then you will be dropped off at Kewalo Basin to board the catamaran. You will need to get a taxi, Uber Lyft at your expense to return to Waikiki hotels 2-miles away. Minimum 4.0" to ride bike or 3.5" for trailer. Bring your own water, snacks or lunch as this is a long day out.

name: BIKE AND KOOLAU WATERFALL HIKE
description: Come join us on this hidden O`ahu Hike and spectacular rainforest bike ride. Our day will begin hiking 1.5 miles in O`ahu's lush volcanic rain forest. Experience the majestic beauty of our towering 35-foot waterfall, tranquil streams, or splash in the shallow picturesque pool as you explore the lush tropical vegetation of Hawaii’s paradise. After the hike, imagine the fun you'll have on our easy 5-mile tropical ride that coasts downhill on a paved road nestled in the lush Pu`u `Ohia rainforest. Includes: Professional nature guides, access to private property hiking, rain gear, hip pack, mosquito repellent, KHS cruiser bikes, Bell helmets, and complimentary round-trip transportation from Kahala, Waikiki & Aloha Tower. Please bring your own water and snacks.
notes: Minimum 4.0" to ride bike or 3.5" for trailer.

name: eBIKE HONOLULU RAINFOREST RIDE
description: Bike Hawaii introduces its first paved E-Bike Honolulu Rainforest Tour of lush tropical mountains of Oahu. Uphill and downhill biking tours with 250-watts of electric-assist power for the climb provides 10-miles of smiles!
notes: Must know how to ride a bike. Be at least 14-years of age. Riders must weigh less than 240lbs.

name: KOOLAU WATERFALL RAINFOREST HIKE
description:
Explore Hidden O`ahu, Discover the hidden treasures of a privately owned waterfall in the lush tropical rainforest of O'ahu.  Available Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday.  
 
Includes: Professional nature guides, access to forest reserve, rain poncho, hip pack, mosquito repellent, and round-trip transportation from Kahala, Waikiki, and Aloha Tower.
notes: No Restrictions.

name: SUNSET SAIL
description: Come join us on our afternoon sail aboard a 40ft twin-hulled catamaran. Enjoy a 2-hour relaxed sail off beautiful Waikiki. BYOB and enjoy relaxing music from our onboard Bose sound system while taking in the sunset colors of our Hawaiian sunset. Snack on a variety of complimentary pupu (appetizers) provided. Leave your world behind and join us on the Sunset Sail.
directions: From Waikiki, meet us at slip A-0, 1125 Ala Moana Blvd (2-miles west of Waikiki)
times: Please be checking in at least 10 minutes before departure

name: West O'ahu Combo - Palehua Hike, Sail and Snorkel
description: Tour Description:  This combo-tour leads guests on a Rainforest to Reef excursion on the West-side of O’ahu. Our professional nature guide will shuttle you by van to the highlands of the Waianae Mountains. The cool forested ridge of Palehua at 2,400ft elevation is a narrated 1.2 mile round-trip nature hike along a privately-owned trail to discover several endemic species of plants and trees. Guests are rewarded with spectacular views of Oahu’s leeward coast into Nanakuli Valley and eastward toward Diamond Head, Honolulu and the Koolau mountains in the distance.  Hike includes snacks and cut fruit at a scenic overlook. The 3-hour sail and snorkel is aboard a 53’ luxury catamaran from Ko Olina. Guests will enjoy narrated history of the area and snorkel with turtles and reef fish and possibly see dolphins and whales Dec-April. We offer this combo twice a week. Wednesday hike first and snorkel after, or on Sunday-snorkel first then enjoy the sunset hike with incredible views of the setting sun from this mountain top perch. BYOB is allowed for sunset hike, but no glass please. Boxed wine or cans is allowed. Return to hotels by van.
notes: Guests are urged to bring a light jacket and your own water and snacks. Wear closed toe shoes with good traction for dirt/mud, dress comfortable and bring a camera.
directions: Transportation from Waikiki and West Oahu hotels, lunch, water, snacks, beverages, (3 alcohol drinks), snorkel gear, swimfins, life vest, waist pack, rain ponchos & mosquito repellent

name: WEST OAHU SAIL SNORKEL 1230pm
description: This tour is a relaxing sail and snorkel aboard a 53ft double-hulled yacht from the Ko Olina marina. Snorkel with turtles and tropical reef fish in the clear blue waters of the Pacific. A delicious lunch is served aboard the boat with 3 complimentary cocktails for those 21 and over. This is offered daily

After your sail and snorkel, you will need to jump in a taxi, UBER, or Lyft at your own expense. We supply Rain gear, KHS cruiser bikes, helmets, and guides. Masks, snorkels, swim fins, and life jackets are provided at no extra charge. Due to COVID, please wear masks in accordance with County Law.
notes: Complimentary pick up from Waikiki for the Bike portion only and then we'll drop you off at the Kewalo Basin just 2-miles west of Waikiki. After your sail and snorkel, you will need to jump a taxi, UBER or Lyft at your own expense. Minimum 4.0" to ride bike or 3.5" for trailer. Bring your own water, snacks or lunch items as this is a long day out.

name: HALF DAY OAHU BIKE, SAIL AND SNORKEL ADVENTURE
description:
Our Half-Day Rainforest to the Reef Adventure 
Join our 'ohana (family) of professional nature guides on this half day adventure "from the Rainforest to the Reef". Coast 5-miles downhill through a lush rainforest over paved road. Stop to take in the sights from high above Honolulu. After the bike ride, we'll drop you off to board the sail and snorkel on a relaxing sail and snorkel adventure off beautiful Waikiki. Learn about the Hawaiian reef and swim/snorkel in the warm waters fronting Waikiki Beach.   
 
Includes: Complimentary pick up from Waikiki for the Bike portion only and then we'll drop you off at the Kewalo Basin just 2-miles west of Waikiki. After your sail and snorkel, you will need to jump a taxi, UBER or Lyft at your own expense. We supply Rain gear, KHS cruiser bikes, helmet, and guide. Masks, snorkels, swim fins and life jackets are provided at no extra charge. Due to COVID, please wear masks upon pick up and during transfer.
notes: Complimentary pick up from Waikiki for the Bike portion only and then we'll drop you off at the Kewalo Basin just 2-miles west of Waikiki. After your sail and snorkel, you will need to jump a taxi, UBER or Lyft at your own expense.

name: HAWAIIAN WATERFALL RAINFOREST HIKE
description: Be an early bird and be some of the first hikers on the trail. Discover the hidden treasures of O`ahu's lush tropical rainforest. Monday, Wednesday and Friday, we hike to the tallest waterfall on Oahu.  Includes: Professional nature guides, access to forest reserve, rain poncho, hip pack, mosquito repellent, and round-trip transportation from Kahala, Waikiki, and Aloha Tower.
notes: No restrictions.

name: OAHU VOLCANIC RAINFOREST HIKE
description: Trek along the slopes of an ancient cinder cone volcano and explore a lush native forest preserve offering sweeping views of O'ahu's two parallel mountain ranges.  Soak in majestic tropical island views as you hike to a 600-foot elevation gain. Rich in rare and endemic plant species, your guided 2.5 mile moderate hike will meander through a native forest as it captures distant scenic views of both the highest point of the volcanic Ko'olau Mountain range (Konahuanui at 3150 feet), the highest point of O'ahu (Mt. Ka'ala at 4025 feet), Le'ahi (Diamond Head) crater, Honolulu, Waikiki;, Pearl Harbor, Kailua, and the shimmering Pacific Ocean.
notes: Must be in physical condition to hike uphill on sometimes slippery terrain with roots and rocks. Sturdy shoes with good traction for dirt and mud required.

name: DOWNHILL BIKE
description: Experience another specialty of Bike Hawaii on our most sought-after downhill bike ride. This easy 5-mile tropical bike ride coasts downhill on a paved road nestled in Oahu's lush Puu Ohia rainforest. This unique experience combines Hawaii’s tropical rainforest, magnificent panoramic views of scenic Oahu, the fragrance of tropical fruits and flowers with Hawaiian culture, history, native species of bird and animals, and its unique geological features. A great Hawaii bike tour for the family! Not recommended for children under 5 years of age. This Hawaii downhill biking adventure is available on its own or can be combined with additional adventures on the same day. To customize your experience, the following adventure combinations are available.
notes: No restrictions. This Downhill Bike tour can be combined with either a Waterfall Hike or the Volcanic Rainforest Hike

name: SINGLE TRACK MOUNTAIN BIKING
description: The dramatic beauty of the lush Maunawili Valley, majestic Ko`olau Mountain cliffs, and stunning ocean views are the backdrops for this epic mountain biking experience. Capture the thrill of riding Hawaiian single track as we explore this sacred and historic tropical valley. Includes: Professional nature guides, access to forest reserve, complimentary round-trip transportation from Waikiki, Kona mountain bikes with front-suspension, Bell helmets, optional use of rain gear, hip pack, bottled water, trail mix, and bottled water.
notes: No restrictions.

name: SAIL & SNORKEL ADVENTURE 1230pm
description:
Encounter the healing powers of Hawaii's Pacific Ocean on a relaxing and intimate catamaran sail off the beautiful Diamond Head and Waikiki coastline of Oahu. Hawaii's 80-degree cobalt and turquoise water becomes a refreshing snorkeling and sailing playground amidst endangered Hawaiian sea turtles, tropical fish, occasional dolphins and seasonal Pacific Humpback whales that frequent this scenic area off Diamond Head. Do as much or as little as you'd like on this catamaran sailing tour off of Waikiki: swim, snorkel, relax and experience the Hawaiian value of "pono" - balance of mind, body and spirit.

Bring your swim attire, towel, sunscreen, hat and sunglasses. Don’t forget a camera - the views are amazing!
notes: Meet us at the Kewalo Basin Boat Harbor at 30 minutes before your departure time, slip A-0. This location is approximately a 5-10 minute drive from Waikiki on Ala Moana Boulevard. Reservations are required.  If driving your own car, bring five quarters for parking meters.Kewalo Basin just 2-miles west of Waikiki. Masks, snorkels, swim fins, and life jackets are provided at no extra charge. Due to COVID, please wear masks per the County laws.

name: SAIL & SNORKEL ADVENTURE 3pm

name: EAST OAHU EXPLORER
description: Explore East Oahu on this unforgettable journey with an exclusive van shuttle to the 1,200 ft. high ridge top at Kamehame, which is part of the Ko’olau Summit Trail (KST). From this privately owned clifftop perch, gaze overlooking Waimanalo Beach and the various shades of the blue Pacific Ocean with several offshore islands seemingly within your reach. This is a spectacular and rare perspective of windward Oahu only offered through our company. A breathtaking point for aerial pictures of Oahu. Now activity level.. great for elders and young children.
notes: No restrictions.

name: BIKE AND WATERFALL HIKE ADVENTURE
description: Come join us on this hidden O`ahu Hike and spectacular rainforest bike ride. Our day will begin discovering O`ahu's lush volcanic rain forest. This moderate 2-mile round-trip guided hike is an  opportunity to explore the lush volcanic rainforest of Manoa Valley. Experience the majestic beauty of a towering 200-foot waterfall, tranquil streams, picturesque pools  and lush tropical vegetation.  After the hike, imagine the fun you'll have on our easy 5-mile tropical ride that coasts downhill on a paved road nestled in the lush Pu`u `Ohia rainforest.  Includes: Professional nature guides, access to the watershed, rain gear, hip pack, mosquito repellent, KHS cruiser bikes, Bell helmets, and complimentary round-trip transportation from Kahala, Waikiki & Aloha Tower.
notes: Minimum 4.0" to ride bike or 3.5" for trailer.

name: BIKE and VOLCANIC HIKE
description: Enjoy a guided tour of Oahu's natural past and present. Explore the ancient remains of Oahu's volcanic cinder cones now covered in lush rainforest. Hike has 600ft of elevation gain with 2.5 miles of hiking on uneven and sometimes slippery trail. Then, we'll saddle up for a 5-mile downhill coast on paved road with fabulous views of Oahu's south shore and blue Pacific Ocean in the distance.
notes: Must be fit enough to hike without assistance.

name: WATERFALL and KAMEHAME CLIFFS
description: Discover a hidden waterfall and then an epic ridge top vista from high atop the Koolau mountain at a 600-acre private property. This moderate 2-mile round-trip guided waterfall hike is an opportunity to explore  the majestic beauty of a towering double tiered Koolau waterfall, tranquil streams, picturesque pools and lush tropical vegetation of Hawaii’s paradise Explore East Oahu on this unforgettable journey with an exclusive van shuttle to the 1,200 ft. high ridge top at Kamehame, which is part of the Ko’olau Summit Trail (KST). From this privately owned clifftop perch, gaze overlooking Waimanalo Beach and the various shades of the blue Pacific Ocean with several offshore islands seemingly within your reach. This is a spectacular and rare perspective of windward Oahu only offered through our company. A breathtaking point for aerial pictures of Oahu. Now activity level.. great for elders and young children.
notes: No restrictions.

name: Chiefs Luau Aloha Experience - Transportation included
description:
Experience a lu'au like none other with Chief Sielu and his tribe of fire twirling, tree climbing, comedic, dynamic Polynesian drummers, dancers and entertainers. 

Interact one-on-one with the dancers as they help you weave your own headband from banana leaves.  Toss a spear,  learn to hula.  Taste poi.  Taste Lomi Lomi Salmon.  

Gather around Chief's 'Imu as he unearths your dinner.  Enjoy his all-you-can-eat Lu'au feast with traditional Hawaiian dishes like mouth-watering Kalua pork, sauteed island fish, and pineapple chicken.

Dance under moonlit skies.

Your evening culminates with the funniest, most authentic and romantic Polynesian show in the South Pacific highlighted by an unparalleled 10-minute 8-man fire dance.

Produced by Chief Sielu, the original World Fire-Knife Dance Champion, Comedian and Ambassador of Polynesia.  The Chief has your evening planned.  The memories will last a lifetime. 

ALOHA EXPERIENCE INCLUDES: Shell Lei greeting, Aloha seating section (see seating chart), 1 drink ticket

name: Tour #11: Majestic Circle Island
description:
Come with us on an adventure and discover all of Oahu’s majestic grandeur.  Be captivated by the unique beauty and the dramatic history found at every turn. 

History comes alive before your eyes as you weave up the Koʻolau Mountains to the Nuʻuanu Pali Lookout where King Kamehameha I battled to unite the Hawaiian Islands.  Shortly after, gaze at the beautiful Byodo-In Temple, a replica of the Byodo-in Temple in Japan, that was built to commemorate the 100-year anniversary of the first Japanese immigrants in Hawaiʻi.  

Cruise along seven miles of world famous surfing beaches on Oahu’s North Shore, and sample the local flavors along the way.

Waimea Valley and waterfalls await you, steeped with history, spirituality and island traditions. Your E Noa guide will take you through the botanical gardens of this vast and tranquil setting. Learn how deeply embedded tradition is in today’s Hawaiian culture. 

Around the corner is the Historic Dole Plantation surrounded by rows of pineapple and fields of sugarcane.  Your E Noa guide will share the rich plantation history and describe how this famously sweet plant became a symbol of Hawaiʻi. 

Fasten your seatbelts for an amazing excursion that will leave you brimming with the Aloha Spirit!
notes: Face masks/coverings required. Wear walking shoes and dress comfortably. Swimwear/tower optional. Waterfall hike is moderately challenging thus may be unsuitable for those with medical conditions. Please consult your physician.
directions: FREE Pick-up services for guests staying in hotels located within Waikiki, Ala Moana and Kahala areas as well as cruise ship passengers docked at Pier 2 and Pier 11.
times: Daily 8:00 am - 8:20 am pickup; 5:00 pm approximate return

name: Tour #77A: Salute To Pearl Harbor by Waikiki Trolley
description:
Available Daily ~ Pick Up time between 7:30AM-7:50AM ~ Return approx. 12:45PM

Stand at ground zero of the infamous attack and gaze up at a sky once filled with enemy planes.  This is the place where history was made. 

The E Noa Salute To Pearl Harbor Tour immerses you in the sights, sounds and personal stories of the world-changing events of Pearl Harbor, December 1941.  This is the way to see Pearl Harbor; with a knowledgeable E Noa guide who provides helpful insight and information, fascinating historical and cultural background-with the ease of transportation and a tour package that includes everything you need to visit the WWII Valor of the Pacific Monument and the USS Arizona Memorial.

Upon picking you up, your E Noa guide begins to share local stories and interesting bits of history-setting the scene of that fateful day in December 1941-as you head towards Honolulu's Pearl Harbor.  Soon, you arrive full of anticipation at one of Oahu's most famous destinations.

You feel the site's power as you enter the new Pacific Historic Parks Pearl Harbor Visitor Center.  Here you revisit the past through never- before-seen artifacts, replicas and media displays that explain the events and details of the day leading up to and following the Pearl Harbor attack.  Looking across the harbor's blue waters at Ford Island, the center of the attack, you imagine the residents waking up on a Sunday morning to chaos and madness.

Traveling across the harbor by shuttle boat, and then standing in reflection on the USS Arizona Memorial, you pause in tribute to those who lost their lives that day. This graceful monument built over the remains of the sunken ship provides a moving balance of life and death, as you spot green sea turtles and colorful fish swimming in the active reef around the Arizona, even as it serves to memorialize those entombed below.

A movie, a boat trip across the harbor, and perhaps a chance to meet a survivor of the attack complete your morning at the Memorial.

Stops and sites on the Salute To Pearl Harbor Tour may include:
*WWII Valor in the Pacific Monument and Arizona Memorial
**Security restrictions at Pearl Harbor will be enforced.  Please do not bring large bags or anything that could offer concealment.  Storage is available at Pearl Harbor for $6.00.

Attire: Dress comfortably but please remember that shirts and shoes required on the USS Arizona Memorial; swimsuits not permitted.  

*Driver reserves right to adjust route for maximum visitor enjoyment and safety.
*Be ready for spur-of-the-moment stops, unexpected views and special sightseeing along the way!
notes:
Attire: Dress comfortably but please remember that shirts and shoes required on the USS Arizona Memorial; swimsuits not permitted.  
*Security restrictions at Pearl Harbor will be enforced. Please do not bring large bags or anything that could offer concealment. If this is unavoidable, storage is available at Pearl Harbor for $6.00.

On rare occasions the Navy suspends boat operations to the USS Arizona Memorial. In such cases, you can still enjoy USS Arizona exhibits, the Visitor Center and park monuments.
directions: FREE Pick-up services for guests staying in hotels located within Waikiki, Ala Moana and Kahala areas as well as cruise ship passengers docked at Pier 2 and Pier 11.
times: Daily 7:30 am - 7:50 am pickup; 12:45 pm approximate return

name: Tour #66B: Pearl Harbor Remembered by Waikiki Trolley
description:
Available Daily ~ Pick Up: 7:30-7:50AM ~ Return: Approx. 2:30PM

Let us handle all the details including transportation, entrance fees and tickets.  Just relax and come along for the ride. 

Sightseeing in Hawai'i isn't complete without a visit to the two symbolic bookends of the Pacific War- the USS Arizona whose bombing was the catalyst that propelled the US into WWII- and the USS Missouri on whose decks the Japanese formally surrendered.  The Pearl Harbor Remembered Tour is led by an E Noa guide whose knowledge of and appreciation for these historic sites makes this memorial tour an experience to remember.  

It's early morning, and as you head towards Honolulu's infamous Pearl Harbor. Your E Noa guide provides significant island history and background on what you will see.

Exhibits and artifacts at the Pacific Historic Parks Pearl Harbor Visitor Center set the scene, vividly depicting the events of December 1941.  Next, you head by boat to the USS Arizona Memorial, where visitors from around the world pause to reflect; looking down on the ruins of the sunken WWII battleship.  

Aboard the nearby USS Missouri you learn about Mighty Mo's wartime history and see a signed copy of the surrender document that ended the war. Don't miss the USS Oklahoma Memorial, a monument to those who lost their lives in the attack on Pearl Harbor.

Your E Noa guide takes you through downtown Honolulu and past the historic buildings that were a part of Hawaii's history as a monarchy, a territory, and as the 50th state.  

Stops and sites on the Pearl Harbor Remembered Tour may include:
*WWII Valor in the Pacific Monument & USS Arizona Memorial
*USS Missouri Battleship on Ford Island
*Historic Downtown Honolulu (Drive Through Only)

***Security restrictions at Pearl Harbor will be enforced.  Please do not bring large bags or anything that could offer concealment.  Storage is available at Pearl Harbor for $6.00.
**Snacks are available at the USS Arizona Memorial Visitor Center and the USS Missouri gift shop.
**Driver reserves right to adjust route for maximum visitor enjoyment and safety.
**Be ready for spur-of-the-moment stops, unexpected views and special sightseeing along the way!

Attire: Dress comfortably but please remember that shirts and shoes required on the USS Arizona Memorial; swimsuits not permitted.  High heels, dresses and skirts not recommended.  Bags not allowed in Pearl Harbor Visitor Center but if needed may be checked and stored for $6.00 per item
notes:
Dress comfortably, but keep in mind that shirt and shoes are required on the USS Arizona Memorial and that swimsuits are not permitted. High heels, dresses and skirts not recommended.

Security restrictions at Pearl Harbor will be enforced. Please do not bring large bags or anything that could offer concealment. If this is unavoidable, storage is available at Pearl Harbor for $6.00.

On rare occasions the Navy suspends boat operations to the USS Arizona Memorial. In such cases, you can still enjoy USS Arizona exhibits, the Visitor Center and park monuments.

Eating a light meal before your pick-up time is recommended.
Snacks are available from the USS Arizona Memorial Visitor Center and at the USS Missouri gift shop.
directions: FREE Pick-up services for guests staying in hotels located within Waikiki.
times: Daily 7:30 am - 7:50 am pickup; 2:30 pm approximate return

Attire: Dress comfortably but please remember that shirts and shoes required on the USS Arizona Memorial; swimsuits not permitted.  High heels, dresses and skirts not recommended.  Bags not allowed in Pearl Harbor Visitor Center but if needed may be checked and stored for $6.00 per item
notes:
Dress comfortably, but keep in mind that shirt and shoes are required on the USS Arizona Memorial and that swimsuits are not permitted. High heels, dresses and skirts not recommended.

*Security restrictions at Pearl Harbor will be enforced. Please do not bring large bags or anything that could offer concealment. If this is unavoidable, storage is available at Pearl Harbor for $6.00.

On rare occasions the Navy suspends boat operations to the USS Arizona Memorial. In such cases, you can still enjoy USS Arizona exhibits, the Visitor Center and park monuments.

Eating a light meal before your pick-up time is recommended.  
Snacks are available from the USS Arizona Memorial Visitor Center and at the USS Missouri gift shop.
directions: FREE Pick-up services for guests staying in hotels located within Waikiki.
times: Daily 6:30 am - 6:50 am pickup; 1:30 pm approximate return

name: Waikiki Trolley Scenic Diamond Head & City Tour
description: Available Monday, Wednesday & Saturday ~ Pick Up via Waikiki Trolley Open-Air Trolley at 10:00AM and 12:00PM ~ Outside T Galleria by DFS 330 Royal Hawaiian Avenue.
notes: Hop-on, hop-off not available. Face masks/coverings required.

name: Waikiki Trolley Holiday Lights Tour
description:
Reservations Required. Tours available daily December 5-26, 2021 ~ Begins/ends at Ward Village Victoria Ward Park mountain side of Auahi Street every 30 minutes between 6:00PM and 9:30PM.

Every Holiday Season, Downtown Honolulu comes alive in a veritable galaxy of festive holiday lights. Enjoy dazzling lights, joyous Christmas sing-alongs and jolly Yuletide stories from the comfort of an open-air double decker!

Jolly tour includes disembarking at Honolulu Hale's famous City Lights.  Enjoy the city's 50-foot holiday tree, beautifully decorated Christmas tree exhibits, Shaka Santa, Tutu Mele and more outdoor displays.
notes: Safe Access Oahu requirements will be enforced for entry to Honolulu Hale tree exhibit area (proof of Covid-19 vaccination or 48-hour negative test results).
directions: *Reservations required

name: Tour #33: Ultimate Pearl Harbor Circle Island
description:
This all-encompassing tour lead by an E Noa tour guide whose knowledge and love of the island will leave you wanting to come back for more.  It's a great value including any required admission fees and we'll make sure you get lunch!

Your day begins at sunrise as you head out to re-live a striking historical moment in time at the World War II Valor in the Pacific Monument and USS Arizona Memorial.  In this quietly moving place, you experience the history, tragedy, and heroism of the attack that propelled the U.S. into World War II.   Take a boat ride out to the 184-foot USS Arizona Memorial structure that actually spans the mid-portion of the battleship itself as it rests on the harbor floor.

Stops and sites on Pearl Harbor and North Shore Tour may include:
*World War II Valor in the Pacific Monument 
*USS Arizona Memorial
*Wheeler Army Airfield/Schofield Barracks
*Dole Plantation Visitor Center
*North Shore Surfing Beaches including Sunset Beach, Pipeline, and Waimea Bay
*Complimentary Lunch included
*Ko'olauloa Coastline
*Nu'uanu Pali Lookout (site of 1795 Battle of Nu'uanu)
*Oahu's Eastern Shoreline:Including Waimanalo, Makapu'u, and Sandy Beach
*Halona Blowhole and Lookout
*Hanauma Bay Lookout (Closed every Tuesday)
*Kahala Mansions and Diamond Head Slopes
*Return to Waikiki (Approximately 4:30pm)

**Security restrictions at Pearl Harbor will be enforced.  Please do not bring large bags or anything that could offer concealment.  Storage is available at Pearl Harbor for $6.00.
*Driver reserves right to adjust route for maximum visitor enjoyment and safety.
*Lunch stop en route included.
**Be ready for spur-of-the-moment stops, unexpected views and special sightseeing along the way!

Attire: Dress comfortably but please remember that shirts and shoes required on the USS Arizona Memorial; swimsuits not permitted.  Bags not allowed in Pearl Harbor Visitor Center but if needed may be checked and stored for $6.00 per item.
notes:
Dress comfortably, but keep in mind that shirt and shoes are required on the USS Arizona Memorial and that swimsuits are not permitted.

*Security restrictions at Pearl Harbor will be enforced. Please do not bring large bags or anything that could offer concealment. If this is unavoidable, storage is available at Pearl Harbor for $6.00.

On rare occasions the Navy suspends boat operations to the USS Arizona Memorial. In such cases, you can still enjoy USS Arizona exhibits, the Visitor Center and park monuments.

Eating a light meal before your pick-up time is recommended.
Lunch stop en route, meal purchase included.
directions: FREE Pick-up services for guests staying in hotels located within Waikiki, Ala Moana and Kahala areas as well as cruise ship passengers docked at Pier 2 and Pier 11.

name: Tour #110 ~ Waikele Shopping Tour
description:
Available Daily ~ Pick up: 8:45-9:40AM ~ Return: Approx. 3:30PM

Come discover a shopper's heaven on an island paradise with this shop 'til you drop experience.  
	
On your way to Waikele Center and Waikele Premium Outlets, enjoy fascinating stories and island history making the trip more than just another ride.  The attractive Waikele open-air complex boasts a wide selection of brand name stores at value shopper prices. 

Need a break?  Relax and recharge at your choice of a delicious assortment of restaurants and cafes.  

Stops and sites on the Waikele Shopping Tour include:
*Waikele Center
*Waikele Premium Outlets 
*Return to Waikiki

*Driver reserves right to adjust route for maximum visitor enjoyment and safety.
*Wear comfortable shoes.
notes:
*Driver reserves right to adjust route for maximum visitor enjoyment and safety.
*Wear comfortable shoes.
times: Daily 8:45 am - 9:40 am pickup; 3:30 pm approximate return

name: Experience Package  Schedule A
description:
This package includes our popular Movie Site and Ranch Tour, Jungle Expedition Tour and Kualoa Grown Tour. Buffet lunch is included and served at our Ranch House Lanai at 12:30pm. 


If you are driving out to the ranch check in at the Ticket Office no later than 8:30 am.



Buffet Lunch will include the following: (menu subject to change without notice)

Full Salad Bar includes - 2 choices of greens, 3 types of salad dressings, 9 different condiments, macaroni salad and fruit
Hot Line includes - steamed white rice, buttered corn, teriyaki chicken, BBQ pork ribs, KualoaGrown beef chili
Chefs choice of dessert





Important note regarding transportation from Waikiki: 
Round-trip transportation from Waikiki is available to add on for $30 per person+tax. Reservations for transport must be made at least 24 hours in advance, and is upon availability. If transportation was purchased, pick up in Waikiki will be at the designated time mentioned above.

**For reservations with transportation please check in at the designated pickup area 15 minutes prior to scheduled departure time.**
notes:
Due to the potentially dangerous nature of activities at Kualoa Ranch, liability waivers are required for participation. 

Required: Photo ID matching the name on your reservation must be shown at check in

Children 17 & under must be accompanied by an adult on all tours and must be 3 years and older to participate in this package. 


Important Note:***If you are traveling with other parties for the Experience Package and they are reserved on a different schedule, please note that Schedule A, B and C are different timings for each tour and you will not be together. The difference between schedule A, B and C are internal scheduling for the tour times, which we will provide to you at check in. The package is all in one day, and would have an 9:15am departure/start time (required check in at Kualoa Ranch would be no later than 8:30am) and would finish by 3:15pm.  The Experience Package inclusions would be the Hollywood Movie Site tour, Jungle Expedition tour and the Kualoa Grown Tour.***
directions: From Waikiki and downtown Honolulu, take H-1 freeway west to Likelike highway (63) north. Continue towards Kaneohe thru the Wilson tunnel. Connect onto Kahekili highway (83) west. Continue on 83 west until you reach Kualoa Ranch (approx. 30 mins, 11 miles) on your left. Turn left into the entrance and follow the signs to the parking area.

name: Half Day Package Schedule A
description:
The Half-Day Package encompasses the natural beauty of our 4000 acre property, from the upland valleys all the way down to the crystal blue waters of Kaneohe Bay. Comprising two of our popular tours, the Hollywood Movie Sites Tour and our Ocean Voyage, the package also includes a lunch. The Hollywood Movie Sites Tour showcases some of the most popular and iconic site locations from a few of the more than 200+ movies and tv shows.  For the Ocean Voyage, you’ll take a short catamaran ride across an 800 year old Hawaiian Fishpond, then board our 50 passenger catamaran for the mini-cruise on Kaneohe Bay. Be sure to bring reef-safe sunscreen, shades and a camera for what surely will be the most amazing pictures and selfies of your Hawaiian vacation.



If you are driving out to the ranch check in at the ticket office no later than 9:35 am.



Buffet Lunch will include the following: (menu subject to change without notice)

Full Salad Bar includes - 2 choices of greens, 3 types of salad dressings, 9 different condiments, macaroni salad and fruit
Hot Line includes - steamed white rice, buttered corn, teriyaki chicken, BBQ pork ribs, KualoaGrown beef chili
Chefs choice of dessert



Important note regarding transportation from Waikiki: 
Round-trip transportation from Waikiki is available to add on for $30 per person+tax. Reservations for transport must be made at least 24 hours in advance, and is upon availability. If transportation was purchased, pick up in Waikiki will be at the designated time mentioned above.

**For reservations with transportation please check in at the designated pickup area 15 minutes prior to scheduled departure time.**
notes:
Due to the potentially dangerous nature of activities at Kualoa Ranch, liability waivers are required for participation. 

Required: Photo ID matching the name on your reservation must be shown at check in

Children 17 & under must be accompanied by an adult on all tours.

If traveling with infants (2 years and younger): Guests of all ages will need to be included in the reservation. Lunch is only included for participants 3 years and older, if traveling with infants you will need to bring or purchase lunch separately. 
Infants will be seated on your lap at all times on vehicles, while on the tours there is no secured seating, a body harness/carrier is recommended. 



Important Note:***If you are traveling with other parties for the Half Day Package and they are reserved on a different schedule, please note that Schedule A and B are different timings for each tour and you will not be together. The difference between schedule A and B are internal scheduling for the tour times, which we will provide to you at check in. The package is all in one day, and would have a 10:15am start/departure time (required check in at Kualoa Ranch would be no later than 9:35am) and finish by 3:00pm.  The Half Day Package inclusions would be the Hollywood Movie Site Tour and the Ocean Voyage Tour.***
directions: From Waikiki and downtown Honolulu, take H-1 freeway west to Likelike highway (63) north. Continue towards Kaneohe thru the Wilson tunnel. Connect onto Kahekili highway (83) west. Continue on 83 west until you reach Kualoa Ranch (approx. 30 mins, 11 miles) on your left. Turn left into the entrance and follow the signs to the parking area.

name: 2 Hour UTV Raptor - 8:00am
description:
A great way to see Kualoa up close and personal! Families (6 total seat belts) can drive their own Raptor on trails deep into the scenic valleys and to remote areas rarely visited by others. Our Multi Passenger Raptor tours go out rain or shine - rambling through the mud and crossing seasonal streams are part of the fun! Our two hour tour will take you over a saddle trail to explore our beautiful 1,000 acre Ka'a'awa Valley.
Tours will go out in a group, a Kualoa tour guide will lead the Raptors on the trail. There are no narrations on this tour. 

Transportation from Waikiki is not available for this activity 



Tour departs at 8:00 am. You will need to drive out to the ranch and check in at the Ticket Office no later than 7:30 am.
notes:
Tour Requirements: Minimum age for driver is 21 years old and driver will be required to show current valid drivers license at tour check in.

Passenger minimum age is 5 years old. 

Safety helmets provided and required to be worn at all times. 

Upon check in, before departing on the tour all tour restrictions will be checked, if anyone does not meet the tour requirements, they would not be able to continue on the tour.

Covered shoes recommended. 



Required: Photo ID matching the name on your reservation must be shown at check in
directions: From Waikiki and downtown Honolulu, take H-1 freeway west to Likelike highway (exit 63) north. Continue towards Kaneohe thru the Wilson tunnel. Connect onto Kahekili highway (exit 83) west. Continue on 83 west until you reach Kualoa Ranch (approx. 30 mins, 11 miles) on your left. Turn left into the entrance and follow the signs to the parking area.

name: 2 Hour UTV Raptor - 2:45pm
description:
A great way to see Kualoa up close and personal! Families (6 total seat belts) can drive their own Raptor on trails deep into the scenic valleys and to remote areas rarely visited by others. Our Multi Passenger Raptor tours go out rain or shine - rambling through the mud and crossing seasonal streams are part of the fun! Our two hour tour will take you over a saddle trail to explore our beautiful 1,000 acre Ka'a'awa Valley.
Tours will go out in a group, a Kualoa tour guide will lead the Raptors on the trail. There are no narrations on this tour. 




Tour departs at 2:45 pm. You will need to drive out to the ranch and check in at the Ticket Office no later than 2:00 pm.
notes:
Tour Requirements: Minimum age for driver is 21 years old and driver will be required to show current valid drivers license at tour check in.

Passenger minimum age is 5 years old. 

Safety helmets provided and required to be worn at all times. 

Upon check in, before departing on the tour all tour restrictions will be checked, if anyone does not meet the tour requirements, they would not be able to continue on the tour.

Covered shoes recommended. 



Required: Photo ID matching the name on your reservation must be shown at check in
directions: From Waikiki and downtown Honolulu, take H-1 freeway west to Likelike highway (exit 63) north. Continue towards Kaneohe thru the Wilson tunnel. name: 2 Hour Ride Along UTV Raptor - 8:00am
description:
RIDE ALONG MULTI-PASSENGER UTV RAPTOR TOUR
On this tour you will be able to ride along with one of our tour guides on our popular UTV two hour tour. Kualoa’s open-air multi-passenger UTV Raptor vehicles are a great way to enjoy the experience with friends and family … as well as give you the flexibility of taking photos along the way, and learning all about the sights from your guide.



On this limited tour, with your guide as the driver, you be able to sit back and enjoy the amazing views of Ka'a'awa (Jurassic) Valley, Kualoa and Hakipu'u.  Each Raptor can hold up to 4 passengers, one up front, and 2 or 3 in the back seat. (depending on how many kids there are in your party). Your guide will drive you deep into scenic valleys and remote areas, often rambling through dirt roads, dusty trails and crossing seasonal streams. 
 

IMPORTANT TO NOTE:

Get ready for a DUSTY & DIRTY adventure ! Tours go out rain or shine, so we recommend checking the weather and bringing a change of clothes if necessary.
Minimum rider age is 5 years old.  YOU WILL NOT BE DRIVING THIS VEHICLE.
We suggest wearing appropriate clothing, footwear and bringing sunglasses.
Advanced reservations are recommended as tours may sell out.






Transportation from Waikiki is not available for this activity 



Tour departs at 8:0 am. You will need to drive out to the ranch and check in at the Ticket Office no later than 7:30 am.
notes:
Tour Requirements: Must be 5 years and older to participate in this tour. All children 17 year and younger must be accompanied by an adult on this tour. 

A Kualoa Tour Guide will be driving the UTV Raptor at all times. 

This tour goes out in a group with other vehicles. 


Safety helmets provided and required to be worn at all times. 

Upon check in, before departing on the tour all tour restrictions will be checked, if anyone does not meet the tour requirements, they would not be able to continue on the tour.


Covered shoes recommended. 



Required: Photo ID matching the name on your reservation must be shown at check in
directions: From Waikiki and downtown Honolulu, take H-1 freeway west to Likelike highway (exit 63) north. Continue towards Kaneohe thru the Wilson tunnel. Connect onto Kahekili highway (exit 83) west. Continue on 83 west until you reach Kualoa Ranch (approx. 30 mins, 11 miles) on your left. Turn left into the entrance and follow the signs to the parking area.

name: 2 Hour Ride Along UTV Raptor - 10:30am
description:
RIDE ALONG MULTI-PASSENGER UTV RAPTOR TOUR
On this tour you will be able to ride along with one of our tour guides on our popular UTV two hour tour. Kualoa’s open-air multi-passenger UTV Raptor vehicles are a great way to enjoy the experience with friends and family … as well as give you the flexibility of taking photos along the way, and learning all about the sights from your guide.



On this limited tour, with your guide as the driver, you be able to sit back and enjoy the amazing views of Ka'a'awa (Jurassic) Valley, Kualoa and Hakipu'u.  Each Raptor can hold up to 4 passengers, one up front, and 2 or 3 in the back seat. (depending on how many kids there are in your party). Your guide will drive you deep into scenic valleys and remote areas, often rambling through dirt roads, dusty trails and crossing seasonal streams.  
 

IMPORTANT TO NOTE:

Get ready for a DUSTY & DIRTY adventure ! Tours go out rain or shine, so we recommend checking the weather and bringing a change of clothes if necessary.
Minimum rider age is 5 years old.  YOU WILL NOT BE DRIVING THIS VEHICLE.
We suggest wearing appropriate clothing, footwear and bringing sunglasses.
Advanced reservations are recommended as tours may sell out.





Tour departs at 10:30 am. You will need to drive out to the ranch and check in at the Ticket Office no later than 9:45 am.
notes:
Tour Requirements: Must be 5 years and older to participate in this tour. All children 17 year and younger must be accompanied by an adult on this tour. 

A Kualoa Tour Guide will be driving the UTV Raptor at all times. 

This tour goes out in a group with other vehicles. 


Safety helmets provided and required to be worn at all times. 

Upon check in, before departing on the tour all tour restrictions will be checked, if anyone does not meet the tour requirements, they would not be able to continue on the tour.


Covered shoes recommended. 



Required: Photo ID matching the name on your reservation must be shown at check in
directions: From Waikiki and downtown Honolulu, take H-1 freeway west to Likelike highway (exit 63) north. Continue towards Kaneohe thru the Wilson tunnel. Connect onto Kahekili highway (exit 83) west. Continue on 83 west until you reach Kualoa Ranch (approx. 30 mins, 11 miles) on your left. Turn left into the entrance and follow the signs to the parking area.

name: 8:00am - Horseback 2-Hour Tour
description:
Kualoa’s two-hour Horseback tour offer guests the opportunity to experience the spectacular scenery of Oahu’s hidden valleys. 


Tour departs at 8:00 am. You will need to drive out to the ranch and check in at the Ticket Office no later than 7:30 am. 


Transportation from Waikiki is not available for this activity
notes:

Due to the potentially dangerous nature of activities at Kualoa Ranch, liability waivers are required for participation.

name: Horseback Ride 1 hour - 9:20am
description: Horseback riding is just one of the unforgettable activities you can enjoy at beautiful Kualoa Ranch. On the one hour ride see the southern half of the ranch. Vistas of the famed Chinaman's Hat Mokoli'i island and an ancient 800 year-old Hawaiian fishpond accompany the great feeling of spending time riding horses.
notes:
Horseback: 10 years and up and 4ft 6in or taller; 1 hour including briefings. Long pants recommended and shoes required. Weight limit: 230 lbs. 

Due to the Potentially dangerous nature of Activities at Kualoa Ranch, Liability waivers are required for participation.

name: 8:30am - Electric Assisted Mountain Bike Tour (2-Hour Tour) - Novice Level
description:
On the 2-hour Electric Mountain Bike Tour (Novice Level) you will cruise through Kualoa’s valley roads, pastures, and trails on an e-Mountain Bike. While you still have to peddle, these state-of-the-art eBikes have a small electric motor that gives you a boost up the hills and throughout the ride, making for a fun, active and eco-friendly experience getting out into nature. Our novice experience travels ~6 miles through Kualoa and Ka'a'awa valleys, making 4-5 stops along the journey, providing great photo ops and beautiful views. We’ll have your bike adjusted for you, and begin with a safety assessment and short practice ride before starting the tour. 
 
IMPORTANT TO NOTE:
•	Minimum age is 10 years old.
•	Closed-toe shoes required.
•	Height & weight requirements per ebike manufacturer guidelines:
•	Height: between 4’6” – 6’5” (1.4m – 2m)
•	Weight: between 85 – 250 pounds (38kg – 114kg)
•	One rider per bike. Helmets are provided.
•	For your safety and well-being of others, all riders must know how to ride a bike to participate in our bike tours. We conduct a safety briefing and test ride before each tour. If you are unable to demonstrate ability to safely ride, you will be asked to ride in an alternate vehicle or stay back and wait until tour is finished. No refund will be offered.

name: 9:00am - Electric Assisted Mountain Bike Tour (2-Hour Tour) - Novice Level

Our novice experience travels ~6 miles through Kualoa and Ka'a'awa valleys, making 4-5 stops along the journey, providing great photo ops and beautiful views. We’ll have your bike adjusted for you, and begin with a safety assessment and short practice ride before starting the tour.

name: 3:00pm - Hollywood Movie Sites Tour (90 minutes)
description:
Visit the breathtaking Ka`a`awa Valley with views of ranch and farm lands, the locations of many Hollywood movies & TV Series, and World War II bunkers. Over 170 Movies and TV Series filmed at Kualoa include, Jurassic World, Jurassic Park, Jumanji, Fallen Kingdom, Kong Skull Island, Godzilla, 50 First Dates, LOST , Hawaii Five-O & Magnum PI.

This is a 1.5 hour tour on a vintage school bus. 


Tour departs at 3:00 pm. You will need to drive out to the ranch and check in at the Ticket Office no later than 2:15 pm.
notes:
Required: Photo ID matching the name on your reservation must be shown at check in


Children 12 & under must be accompanied by an adult on all tours.
If traveling with an infant (2 years old and younger) they must be included in the reservation and would need to be seated on your lap during the tour. 



Note: Tours may go out with multiple vehicles, by making this reservation you confirmed you are aware that your party may be split into different vehicles (vehicle capacities may vary)
directions: From Waikiki and downtown Honolulu, take H-1 freeway west to Likelike highway (63) north. Continue towards Kaneohe thru the Wilson tunnel. Connect onto Kahekili highway (route #83) west. Continue on 83 west until you reach Kualoa Ranch (approx. 30 mins, 11 miles) on your left. Turn left into the entrance and follow the signs to the parking area.

name: 10:00am  - Jungle Expedition Tour (90 minutes)
description:
Marvel as the stories of Kualoa are shared on this tour which takes visitors to upper Hakipu’u Valley, where Ali`i (royalty) once lived and trained in ancient arts. Stop at the Wahi Pana (Celebrated place) and experience the culture of Hawaii. The tour then continues into the lush, tropical rain forest of the Ahupua`a where you will encounter breathtaking views of both ocean and jungle.


Tour departs at 10:00 am. You will need to drive out to the ranch and check in at the Ticket Office no later than 9:15 am.
notes:
Must be minimum 3 years old to participate in this tour. Guests with back problems or expectant mothers are not advised to participate in this tour.

Children 12 & under must be accompanied by an adult on all tours.


Required: Photo ID matching the name on your reservation must be shown at check in




Note: Tours may go out with multiple vehicles, by making this reservation you confirmed you are aware that your party may be split into different vehicles (vehicle capacities may vary)
directions: From Waikiki and downtown Honolulu, take H-1 freeway west to Likelike highway (63) north. Continue towards Kaneohe thru the Wilson tunnel. Connect onto Kahekili highway (route #83) west. Continue on 83 west until you reach Kualoa Ranch (approx. 30 mins, 11 miles) on your left. Turn left into the entrance and follow the signs to the parking area.

name: 11:00am - Kualoa Grown Tour (90 minutes)
description:
Our Kualoa Grown Tour allows guests to see the beauty and tranquility of one of Oahu’s most well-preserved ancient Hawaiian fishponds (Moli’i), which is carbon-dated at between 800 and 1,000 years old. Listed on the National Register of Historic Places by the United States Department of the Interior, you’ll get to learn about early Hawaiian aquaculture practices and how fish was farmed in this 153-acre actively farmed fishpond, still standing with much of the original stonewall infrastructure in place.

Guests will travel on a Trolley to explore the tropical fruit and flower gardens of Moli’i. Admire the accomplishments of the early Hawaiians as the rich stories of the voyaging canoe and ancient fishpond unfold.




Tour departs at 11:00 am. If you are driving out to the ranch check in at the ticket office no later than 10:30 am. 

Transportation from Waikiki available at an additional charge. If transportation was purchased, pick up in Waikiki will be at the designated time mentioned above. 
**Please check in at the designated pickup area 15 minutes prior to scheduled departure time.**
notes:
Children 12 & under must be accompanied by an adult on all tours.


Required: Photo ID matching the name on your reservation must be shown at check in
directions: From Waikiki and downtown Honolulu, take the H-1 Freeway west to the Likelike (Highway 63 exit). Take the Likelike Highway towards Kaneohe through the Wilson Tunnel. Look for the Kahekili exit on the right after you exit the tunnel. Highway curves to the left and you will head north until you reach Kualoa Ranch (approx. 30mins. 11miles) The ranch is located across Kualoa Regional park. Go past the park entrance around the curve of Kamehameha Highway and look for the Kualoa visitor Center sign on your left. Turn left into the Entrance and follow the signs to the parking area.

name: 11:00am  - Ocean Voyage (90 minutes)
description:
To start off with you’ll cross Moli’i fishpond, an 800 yr old example of ancient Hawaiian aquaculture, where you will learn about sustainable fishing practices as well as our oyster farm and current stewardship practices. Soon after you’ll arrive at “Secret Island” where you will board our catamaran for an ocean tour of Kaneohe Bay. This tour offers spectacular views of Mokoli’i Island, Hakipu’u and Kualoa valleys, and the Ko’olau mountain range. If you’re lucky you may also see turtles or other wildlife.


IMPORTANT TO NOTE:

This tour requires guests to be able to climb stairs to board our catamaran.
We suggest wearing appropriate clothing and sun protection.



Tour departs at 11:00 am. If you are driving out to the ranch check in at the ticket office no later than 10:30 am. 


Transportation from Waikiki available at an additional charge. If transportation was purchased, pick up in Waikiki will be at the designated time mentioned above. 
**Please check in at the designated pickup area 15 minutes prior to scheduled departure time.**
notes:
Due to State Laws affecting Kaneohe Bay, this tour does NOT operate on Sunday’s and Federal Holiday’s.

Children 12 & under must be accompanied by an adult on all tours.


Required: Photo ID matching the name on your reservation must be shown at check in
directions: From Waikiki and downtown Honolulu, take H-1 freeway west to Likelike highway (63) north. Continue towards Kaneohe thru the Wilson tunnel. Connect onto Kahekili highway (route #83) west. Continue on 83 west until you reach Kualoa Ranch (approx. 30 mins, 11 miles) on your left. Turn left into the entrance and follow the signs to the parking area.

name: 8:00am - Zipline Tour
description:
With 7 ziplines, 2 suspension bridges and 5 mini-trails, our amazing Zipline tour will immerse you in the natural beauty of Ka`a`awa. You’ll see spectacular vistas like no other on O`ahu and learn about native plants and their uses, native fruits, and smell fragrant flowers along the way.

Tour departs at 8:00 am. If you are driving out to the ranch check in at the ticket office no later than 7:30 am. 

Transportation from Waikiki is not available for this activity
notes:
Upon check in, before departing on the tour all tour restrictions will be checked, if anyone does not meet the tour requirements, they would not be able to continue on the tour. 

Required: Photo ID matching the name on your reservation must be shown at check in


Due to the physical nature of activities at Kualoa Ranch &
Private Nature Reserve, liability waivers are required for participation.

For the safety of our guests, we require that all participants on the Zipline Tour meet the following body size requirements: Height, waist, and upper thigh sizing ensure proper fit of the harness. Weight restrictions ensure proper zip speeds.

Minimum Height: 4’8”
Maximum Height: 6’9”
Minimum Waist Size: 22 in or 55 cm
Maximum Waist Size: 50 in or 127 cm
Minimum Upper Thigh: 18 in or 45 cm
Maximum Upper Thigh: 28 in or 71 cm
Minimum Weight: 70 lbs
Maximum Weight: 280 lbs

General Requirements:
• Anyone who has recently experienced a spinal injury; has head, neck or back pain; or has recently undergone surgery should refrain from participation in the Zipline
Tour.
• All Zipline Tour participants will be required to wear a harness with straps placed at the participant’s upper thighs, waist (above hip bones), and over each shoulder. Anyone with an injury to these areas should refrain from participation to avoid aggravating the injury. 
• All Zipline Tour participants must be able to hike on uneven terrain. Hikes should last no longer than 8-10 minutes and are generally in shaded areas.
• Total tour time is approximately 3 hours long. This may vary depending on weather conditions.
• If you think you may be pregnant, please refrain from participating in the Zipline Tour, as wearing a harness may cause complications for the mother and/or unborn child.
• Proper attire can include athletic shorts, leggings, yoga pants, and T-shirts. Dresses/skirts are not recommended.
• Closed-toe shoes must be worn on the Zipline Tour at all times.
• Long hair should be styled in a bun or ponytail type hairdo to prevent entanglement with zipline apparatus.
• Loose jewelry or clothing should not be worn on the Zipline Tour, as it may become entangled with zipline apparatus.
• Children 17 & under must be accompanied by an adult on tour.
directions:
From Waikiki and downtown Honolulu, take H-1 Freeway west to Likelike Highway (63) north. Continue towards Kāneʽohe thru the Wilson Tunnel. Connect onto Kahekili Highway (83) west.
Continue on 83 west until you reach Kualoa Ranch & Private Nature Reserve (approx. 30 mins, 11 miles) on your left. Turn left into the entrance and follow the signs to the parking area.

• Long hair should be styled in a bun or ponytail type hairdo to prevent entanglement with zipline apparatus.
• Loose jewelry or clothing should not be worn on the Zipline Tour, as it may become entangled with zipline apparatus.
• Children 17 & under must be accompanied by an adult on tour.
directions: From Waikiki and downtown Honolulu, take H-1 freeway west to Likelike highway (63) north. Continue towards Kaneohe thru the Wilson tunnel. Connect onto Kahekili highway (83) west. Continue on 83 west until you reach Kualoa Ranch (approx. 30 mins, 11 miles) on your left. Turn left into the entrance and follow the signs to the parking area.

name: 2:00pm - Zipline Tour
description:
With 7 ziplines, 2 suspension bridges and 5 mini-trails, our amazing Zipline tour will immerse you in the natural beauty of Ka`a`awa. You’ll see spectacular vistas like no other on O`ahu and learn about native plants and their uses, native fruits, and smell fragrant flowers along the way.




Tour departs at 2:00 pm. You will need to drive out to the ranch and check in at the Ticket Office no later than 1:15 pm.
notes:
Upon check in, before departing on the tour all tour restrictions will be checked, if anyone does not meet the tour requirements, they would not be able to continue on the tour. 

Required: Photo ID matching the name on your reservation must be shown at check in



Due to the physical nature of activities at Kualoa Ranch &
Private Nature Reserve, liability waivers are required for participation.

For the safety of our guests, we require that all participants on the Zipline Tour meet the following body size requirements: Height, waist, and upper thigh sizing ensure proper fit of the harness. Weight restrictions ensure proper zip speeds.

Minimum Height: 4’8”
Maximum Height: 6’9”
Minimum Waist Size: 22 in or 55 cm
Maximum Waist Size: 50 in or 127 cm
Minimum Upper Thigh: 18 in or 45 cm
Maximum Upper Thigh: 28 in or 71 cm
Minimum Weight: 70 lbs
Maximum Weight: 280 lbs

General Requirements:
• Anyone who has recently experienced a spinal injury; has head, neck or back pain; or has recently undergone surgery should refrain from participation in the Zipline
Tour.
• All Zipline Tour participants will be required to wear a harness with straps placed at the participant’s upper thighs, waist (above hip bones), and over each shoulder. Anyone with an injury to these areas should refrain from participation to avoid aggravating the injury. 
• All Zipline Tour participants must be able to hike on uneven terrain. Hikes should last no longer than 8-10 minutes and are generally in shaded areas.
• Total tour time is approximately 3 hours long. This may vary depending on weather conditions.
• If you think you may be pregnant, please refrain from participating in the Zipline Tour, as wearing a harness may cause complications for the mother and/or unborn child.
• Proper attire can include athletic shorts, leggings, yoga pants, and T-shirts. Dresses/skirts are not recommended.
• Closed-toe shoes must be worn on the Zipline Tour at all times.
• Long hair should be styled in a bun or ponytail type hairdo to prevent entanglement with zipline apparatus.
• Loose jewelry or clothing should not be worn on the Zipline Tour, as it may become entangled with zipline apparatus.
• Children 17 & under must be accompanied by an adult on tour.
directions:
From Waikiki and downtown Honolulu, take H-1 Freeway west to Likelike Highway (63) north. Continue towards Kāneʽohe thru the Wilson Tunnel. Connect onto Kahekili Highway (83) west.
Continue on 83 west until you reach Kualoa Ranch & Private Nature Reserve (approx. 30 mins, 11 miles) on your left. Turn left into the entrance and follow the signs to the parking area.

name: Doors Off -  8:00 AM
description:
What a rush! Feel the wind in your hair. Embrace the elements. There's nothing between you and the sky. For a truly great helicopter adventure, try the Doors Off experience. Every seat has an excellent view. Doors Off means superb photography. Colors are vibrant and the lush Hawaii landscape incredibly sharp when you avoid shooting through Plexiglas.

	MD500 Helicopter
	Two way communication with your pilot
	Guaranteed window view for all passengers
        Most experienced pilots on Oahu
directions: 130 Iolana Place
